Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: havingfun42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in March before and after a cruise this was our second stay. The rooms are big and very clean. The staff is friendly, helpful and very accommodating. The manager is always visible and talking with the guests. There is a nice breakfast with two or three hot items, fruit, cereal, breads, oatmeal, juice and milk. Mon-Thur there is an evening reception with free food, beer and wine. We will be back next year before our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a suite”
Reviews.Author: Beemaboy
Reviews.Content: this hotel gives great value for money. The condition of the hotel and rooms are of a high standard although the quality of the bathroom did not match the rest of the suite (it was clean though). The buffet breakfast has plenty of choice and the week day evening happy hour is a nice touch. The pool was very well heated too which is always a bonus. We used this hotel as a base for day trips to the everglades and south beach and it is well located for this if you have a car. Also well located for the Dolphin and International malls

Reviews.Title: “Good post-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveclubmed
Reviews.Content: I had two requirements for booking a hotel in Miami: it had to be reasonably convenient to both the airport and the port of Miami, and it had to be able to accomodate separate sleeping areas for my parents and for my husband and I. The Hyatt House was a good option, and I wish I had booked it for our pre-cruise as well. We checked in around 11:30 am, once we finally were able to get a taxi from the Port of Miami after our cruise (what an exercise in patience!). The hotel was able to store our luggage (our room wouldn't be ready until 3:00) and called us a taxi so we could explore Miami beach (south beach). The taxi came very quickly and cost around $30 to get to Ocean Drive. We returned to check-in to our room around 5:00 pm and the front-desk clerk offered us a complimentary cold beverage from their cooler. This small token was very much appreciated by all of us (especially for the beer). The two-bedroom suite was perfect for us. We each had a private ensuite with bath/shower, and the beds were quite comfortable. Each room had a large flat screen tv (three in total) and a very comfortable couch in the living area. We didn't use the kitchen much beyond plates and glasses, but it looked very clean and had nice appliances. There is a heated pool, which we quite enjoyed (although it was perhaps too warm!) and a lovely little hot tub. Pool towels were provided, but a bit difficult to find if you didn't walk past the path that had them. We were told there are a few restaurants in the area, but we were so exhausted that we ordered in a pizza. A couple of menus were already in the room, and the NY Pizza we ordered was quite nice. Breakfast the next morning was a bit of a disappointment. The scrambled eggs were okay and the pre-cooked bacon was alright, but the pre-made waffles were terrible - cold and hard. The hotel would benefit by investing in a couple of make-your-own waffle makers. There were also a couple of cereal options and bread to make toast. I think they had some yogurt as well. On the positive side, the eating area was fairly large and pleasant to be in (felt more like a restaurant, instead of the stuffy and plain breakfast rooms in other hotels). The shuttle from the hotel to the airport runs every half-hour, so make sure you time it right. It was a quick (less than 10 minute) and pleasant ride to the airport. Although I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this property again, there were a couple of things they didn't get right. For me I appreciate small details, and it irritated me that ALL the clocks in the room were wrong. The daylight savings change had happened a week prior, but the clocks were not adjusted. Plus, the alarm in our room suddenly went off at 5am loudly and with static. This quite affected the rest of my sleep and I would have appreciated the room attendant to make sure the alarm was turned off from the previous guest. (we never thought to check). I also would have appreciated a glass to already be placed in each bathroom, rather than having to get one from the kitchen. Overall the hotel is comfortable, conveniently located, relatively quiet (I heard a few of the bigger jets taking off, but was not terribly bothered by this; was more bothered by the screaming child next door in the middle of the night), staff were professional and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: lauracg524
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in March 2012 before a flight to Belize. We weren't expecting much, it was one of the cheapest hotels we could find on a Friday night of Spring Break. We were pleasantly surprised - the room was actually a suite, complete with living room (with a flat screen TV & DVD player!!), kitchen, large bedroom and bathroom. The room was perfect...I wish we could have spent more time there! There was also a pool, fitness room and computer/business room that we did not use. We got a great recommendation from Stanley for some restaurants in South Beach for dinner (which was only a short drive away), but ate the continental breakfast at the hotel before our flight which was your typically hotel breakfast. Plently of fresh fruit and hot coffee! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Accessible, Clean”
Reviews.Author: andiralaw79
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to bunk the night we flew in, the price was right and they gave us a room that was bigger than our apartment. Why we appeared to need two bedrooms I'm not sure, but they gave us a huge room upgrade despite booking on one of the discount sites. There is a full kitchen, and large counter space at the sinks which are outside the bathroom. Breakfast was exceptional - fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, cereal, breads and danishes (also free). It was a great stay- I'd definitely recommend. Lots of free parking. Moments from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to MIA Airport”
Reviews.Author: BRLArgentina
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on a 2 bedroom suite. Great service, very nice room and Sig, the manager was very nice and helpful with all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and great service!”
Reviews.Author: tp2009
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel recently and had a great time. Front-desk staff were great and helpful and generally speaking had a very pleasant stay. Breakfast and the complimentary social hour were quite nice. Only thing that we didn't like a while lot was that housekeeping wasn't that great - like towels were not replaced and nor did they replace coffee/condiments...:( They've a heated pool and open till late. The hot tub wasn't hot enough... We had a hard time initially to locate this place - our GPS kept taking us around. If you see the giant Burger King building, this place is diagonally across to the BK building.

Reviews.Title: “Happy I chose this place”
Reviews.Author: tenvsrini
Reviews.Content: This place is heaven if you are an airline enthusiast. You have a view of the runway from just outside the property, or even from your room if you are on the northern side. There are frequent, complementary shuttles between the airport and the hotel. The staff were cheerful and eager to help. A supermarket and strip mall are situated right next door with plenty of eating options present nearby. The principal malls of the area are not too far away either. My workplace was within walking distance too. Overall a good choice, and I returned for a second stay a few months later. Note: I stayed here more than a year ago, but the earliest date I could select on TripAdvisor was March 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Perfect for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: olsonator
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre-cruise. It was great to have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. It was a short drive from the airport. This location is a couple minute walk from a grocery store and Starbucks and a couple pharmacies. There is a Burger King and a Subway and I think a Cuban restaurant in the same parking lot as these others. Check in was quick and efficient. The staff was friendly. The room was spacious and clean. The pool area was a nice little spot to relax in. The free breakfast was a step up from a normal free breakfast. The coffee however was terrible. The hotel has a shuttle over to the cruise port that was $15 a head. It was convenient and a great value. I would recommend staying at this hotel if you are cruising from the port of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Great Service. Very Military Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Liz F
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying we as a Military family have stayed in many hotels. We make many moves due to my husbands service and this by far has been the best hotel we have stayed in. We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. The first night we came in we were exhausted as we had just finished three days of packers and movers at our home for our move up North. We had a room in one minute after arriving. We asked for a first floor room, as we have three rowdy children and wanted to make no noise on an upstairs floor. It was granted immediately. Our hotel was so spacious and more importantly clean. Each morning they serve a great breakfast with many options. The manager comes around and asks how everything is going. My husband would usually go to breakfast in his Army uniform and many people would stop and thank him for his service. Including many of the employees. Incredible Service!!! Each day room service will come in and make sure everything is tidy. Monday-Thursday they have a social hour with beer and wine available. All types of Finger foods. I had never been in a place with so much to offer already included in the price. My only small complaint about the hotel was there lack of Channels on the Television. I understand they are going through a change with cable providers and that should be fixed shortly. Not really a big deal at all *****One Employee that really stood out to me was Dax. I want to specially recognize Dax for all his help. I recently misplaced my keys while at social hour. I looked everywhere for my keys. I tore my room apart, repacked all items, called the front desk, I even stopped by the Front Desk a few times, my husband also went by and no luck. Each time they would tell me no one turned anything in. It was to the point I was crying in my room. The keys were very important as they had the keys to locks on items we shipped to our new home in Maryland. I had all but given up. I decided to stop Dax by the soda machine as he was one of the few employees that I had not bothered for the keys that day. Dax immediately went to the front desk checked it out and came back with my keys. After worrying my whole day. It took him all but one minute to go and check and realize my keys were there. I cannot thank Dax enough for helping me and taking the time to actually look around. He really saved the day for me. What a superb employee. Thank you Dax your help will always be remembered. *** I recommend this hotel to all, but especially to fellow Military family who are Pcsing and are in need of a home away from home. We will miss our time in Miami and thank the Hyatt House (Summerfield Suites.) for sending us out with a Bang. EXCELLENT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room”
Reviews.Author: LavenderTwin
Reviews.Content: Free drinks and snacks at check in. Loved our room. Great beds. Great parking for our R. V. While we were on the cruise, Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Yell0wBike
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience from start to finish. There is a free airport shuttle to and from the Miami International Airport. The driver was friendly and helpful. Great advise on transportation options that save money for going to the beaches or mhttp://c1.tacdn.com/img2/x.gifalls. I asked for and was granted an early check in. The room (suite) was spotless and comfortable. The hotel can arrange for a money saving shuttle to the cruise ship port. There is a a shopping center on the other side of the block, walking distance from the hotel. There are two well known drug store chains there, as well as a liquor store, grocery and a great Cuban restaurant. They don't have ice machines, so if you want ice, turn on the ice maker in your suite's refrigerator. You will get the occasional jet aircraft noise, but it is incidental for the convenience of staying so close to the airport. They are in the process of changing their name to "Hyatt House".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ichiban
Reviews.Content: Stayed at House House (new name) for 4 nights on business - it was really an excellent experience. The manager, Sig, introduced himself almost immediately after checkin and from then on, called me by name when he saw me and never failed to ask how he could assist. This hotel offers a social hour (Mon-Thurs) with complimentary wine and beer along with a variety of finger foods that changes daily. Also included in your rate is a complimentary hot breakfast, which also changes daily. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are suites and fantastic - a well stocked kitchen, nice living area with TV, work area with plenty of plugs for charging gadgets (and free wi-fi), a good-sized bedroom and bath area. There are several places to eat within walking distance, along with a grocery store, drug store, etc. The location is very convenient to the airport. There is a outdoor pool/jacuzzi and gym, though I haven't had a chance to use either. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again while in the Miami area. They do a great job at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable option in a very expensive city”
Reviews.Author: patti30067
Reviews.Content: So glad we opted to stay near the airport because staying in the South Beach or other more popular areas of Miami are very expensive in January. We were there 3 nights - 3 adults, 1 child - staying in a very spacious 2-bedroom suite. More than enough room for us all - each bedroom has an adjoining bathroom and there is a pull-out couch in the living room. Full kitchen with everything you need, which in our case, wasn't much as we really just ate in for breakfast. But free parking, wi-fi and breakfast with a 2-bedroom suite in Miami was an incredible find and it really wasn't very far to travel to our sightseeing destinations - the zoo, South Beach, Key Biscayne Island, Little Havana and Vizcaya Museum. Some minor issues with operating the DVD (I know, big deal, but we did bring along one movie for our child and the issue was resolved) and the in-room telephones (which we also didn't really need as we all had cell phones). Also thought the room was a bit musty and the pool was on the small side, but really, these are very minor complaints. For this value and if travelling with family during high season, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: McHenryDad
Reviews.Content: I spent one evening here on a business trip to Miami. The hotel is very convenient to the airport without airplane noise. It is about 10 minutes to downtown, 15 minutes to Miami beach, unless it is rush hour in which you need to add at least 20 minutes. If you have a rental car, or just need a spot near the airport for one evening, I would recommend this hotel. The hotel has a small lobby, smaller courtyard, outdoor pool. It is 3 stories with a very slow elevator or convenient staircases. Many of the guests were arriving from or departing for a cruise. My room was very comfortable. The first room includes a small kitchen, desk, family room, and coat closet. The coat closet includes a safe, ironing board, and iron. The desk is equipped with a lamp, phone, and high-end desk chair. The kitchenette includes a counter with 2 stools, a sink with dish soap, a dishwasher with soap, coffee pot, toaster, full size refrigerator/freezer, electric oven and stove with hood. There are four complete table servings, including juice glasses, coffee cups, wine glasses, dinner plates, salad plates, bowls, and silverware. There are cooking utensils, a (manual) can opener, a corkscrew, a strainer, and even a cheese grater. There are cooking pots, pyrex dishes, preparation bowls, but no frying pan. There is coffee, salt and pepper shakers. There is also a sign warning you not to order pizza. The family room includes a couch (with pullout bed), ottoman, TV, and a DVD player. The second room is the bedroom and bath area. I had a king bed, a small dresser, a TV, and alarm clock, and a phone. The bath area includes a closet and a sink with cabinets, in which are a waste basket and hair dryer. A door then leads to the toilet and bathtub/shower with shower curtain. I spent little time in the room, but it was quiet. TV was in the process of being upgraded, so channel selection was limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: erinburke83
Reviews.Content: It was well worth staying a little bit out of downtown in order to stay at this hotel. The prices were significantly less than the over-priced hotels on the other side of the bridge, and the accomodations were far superior. Very clean, great service, complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour, shuttle service and lovely pool area. Basically, it was everything you would expect from a reputable hotel, but with a home vibe to it. Definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: FSU1999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night to attend an event and from check-in to check-out the staff was very accommodating. I had a 2-bedroom suite which had a very nice size and a full-size kitchen. Overall a great hotel with an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: khyron1969
Reviews.Content: After a long day, missing a flight a long taxi ride from fort lauderdale this hotel was a welcome sight. The room was very clean and large. There was plenty of room for all of our group. The shuttle ride was very convenient. The breakfast was very good and for free could not be better. The staff at the desk were very helpful in getting a large taxi for the six of us. One thing is if going on a cruise use a taxi not the shuttle it is only $26 from this hotel to the cruise ships. Did not go anywhere around the hotel since we got in late but overall it was a great place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great MIA Airport Stay!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyingLife
Reviews.Content: Staff is great, rooms clean and comfortable. Amenities like newspapers, breakfast (a real one!), evening reception with wine and snacks are all done with the guests in mind. Convenient free parking, a real plus at Miami airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “2 Bedroom/2 Bath!”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days as a central location for Miami vacation. Since we were traveling somewhere different each day, opted to stay here for the 2 bedroom/2 bath with kitchen suite. Parking is free and easy. Hot breakfast that varied every morning. Social at night although we were never there. Room was great, traveling with college kid so sleeping to noon was not an issue. Hotel is a bit run down, however, it is an airport hotel. Manager is very active here, visible every morning, active throughout the day talking to everyone. Staff is extremely friendly, always with a smile. Hyatt would do well to revamp this place as they have the staff to support a better quality hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The little things I never expected made it A+++”
Reviews.Author: ekevitz
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked into the hotel, I was greated by my name by the Manager Jose, what a great feeling since this was the first time I had stayed at this location. We were probably the last family coming in for the night and the only reservation who had not shown up, but the fact that he had checked my name and was prepared upon our arrival is something I only thought would happen at a 5 star hotel. We were hungry so we grabbed some snacks from the marketplace and when we handed them to the manager to purchase he said, â€œthey are on meâ€�. Again, I was blown away. Lastly, we were traveling with our 6 month old baby so I asked if they had any cribs available and he said, we already have it waiting for you in your room. We travel a lot and I always request the crib when I make the reservation, but this is actually the first time since we had the baby that the hotel actually had the crib waiting for us in the room. Again, all these little things made a huge impression on me. The room is huge, full kitchen with range and microwave, and fridge. Nice living room area with an L shaped couch, sink outside the bathroom and very comfortable beds. The room was clean, smelled great and I trusted it enough to let the baby crawl around on the carpet. Breakfast was great, lots of hot choices to choose from and they also offer a night time hot food offering but I didnâ€™t get to try it during this stay. All in all, this Hyatt far exceeded my expectations and I wish that my family was treated this well at any hotel. Itâ€™s the little things that make all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronin28
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night after our cruise. Beautifully appointed suites with very comfortable sofa bed in the sitting room. Nice kitchenette with everything needed to fix a quick meal. Breakfast was very good. We picked this hotel for the free shuttle to the airport, which runs every half hour. Excellent service. Location wise, nothing close within walking distance. You need a car to get to anywhere. We ended up renting a car for one day because it was cheaper than hiring a taxi to go to south beach. Great stay if you need to be close to the airport/pier.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room and beds, hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: helenann2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed fourn nights while attending a family function in Miami. We rented the 2 bedroom suite, which had two King size beds, two bathrooms, a small living room, and a kitchen. The room was very clean and comfortable, and thebeds were very comfortable also. We chose this hotel because it is "Pet Friendly," and my son's dog would be with us on the final night. When we checked in, I was given some forms to sign, and I should have read it more carefully. Instead of a small fee for pet, or a pet deposit, I was surprised to see upon checkout that the my small dog cost $200! That is the fee whether for one day or more. When I went to thedesk to discuss it, the staff was rude and dismissive. I could have left the dog in a kennel overnight for twenty percent of the fee! The other problem was the free breakfast. Very little variety, and the food ran out every day well before the posted end time. One day, there was no coffee (!) an hour prior to end of breakfast, and they would not refill the coffee pots. Overall, rooms so comfortable and convenient, but don't look for extra services, and don't bring the dog.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: drxmas2005
Reviews.Content: everything was nice!! price ...sitting room ,badroom,kichinette .. breakfast nice even at 5 o clock a good snack for free....gracias!!i will go again

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, free parking and very hot pool & spa”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our son (aged 2) from 9th -> 13 November 2011 in this hotel. It's a bit expensive, but still worth the money, cause the rooms and pool area is very clean. The rooms are very spacious, new and clean. Beds are very confy. The Wi-Fi network is fast and works really well. The pool is really hot, so you can swim for hours, the spa is almost too hot (don't expect to sit in it for long, because you can't due to the high temperature (107 Fahrenheit / 42 Celsius). Their parking is free and the complementary breakfast is okay, with different kinds of bread, cereals, yougurt and scrambled eggs. Next to the reception there are 4 computers with internet and printer, free to use and a gym also free. There are free towl to take to the pool. I do though still not understand american's love for carpets in hallways, breakfast-areas, lobby's & shopping mall's.... because they get really nasty... really quick, in stead of tiles that are easy to clean. This applies to this hotel aswell in hallways & breakfast area. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpfull. It's really close to the airport, but in the rooms you can't hear the planes landing and taking off, so it's not a problem. So if you've got a rentalcar this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay near airport!”
Reviews.Author: Ntasmoha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night and was surprised when we were allowed to check-In two hours early and was upgraded free to a bigger room. The staff was really friendly and helpful. We were shocked that they had a social get together four nights a week and had free drinks and some appetitizer. The rooms were fully equipped with all dishes, glasses etc for eating food or making food on your trip. The pool and spa were nice, clean and relaxing. What a great way to end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: aylee
Reviews.Content: STAY DETAILS November 13-14, 2011 2-bedroom trio Rate: $222.98 via Expedia.com I would highly recommend Hyatt Summerfield Suites Miami Airport if you want to be within close proximity of the airport. We booked the hotel as part of a flight and hotel package via Expedia. We only stayed one night as a pre-cruise accommodation. We originally booked a 2-bedroom 2 king unit. I called Expedia to upgrade to a trio (2-bedroom, 1 king, 2 queen unit), but they didnâ€™t have any available in the system. So the Expedia representative told me to call the hotel directly. I did and the hotel representative made a note on my reservation that I was requesting a trio. Upon check-in, the front desk staff saw the note and found us an available trio unit at no additional cost. LOCATION The hotel is about 5 minutes away from the airport, but we never heard noise from the airport. It is one block away from a shopping center that had Publix, Chinese restaurant, Starbucks, Office Depot, etc. which was great. There are a lot of stores along NW 7th St which is one block away from the hotel. The hotel is a little far if youâ€™re in Miami to go to the beaches. But for a pre-cruise or post-cruise stay, it was perfect. It cost us about $28+tip taxi from the hotel to the cruise port, $23+tip from the hotel to Dolphin Mall, and $25+tip from Dolphin Mall to the hotel. You can also catch the 7 bus on NW 7th St to Dolphin Mall. PREMISES The hotel was clean. The lobby was small, but there were plenty of seating for guests to hang or wait. The grounds was well kept. STAFF Since we only stayed there one night, we only got to meet the front desk staff. They were very nice and willing to help. I always bothered them for a taxi that would accommodate 5 people and we never had to wait. A taxi was always waiting for us as soon as we got to the lobby. ROOM Our room (327) was nice except for the face towel left on the floor in the king bedroom. I guess housekeeping donâ€™t vacuum the floors after every guest. The king bedroom was spacious, but the 2 queen bedroom was a little cramped. And the beds look a little smaller than a queen bed Iâ€™m used to. The beds were comfortable, the pillows were a little too full for me. The living room was a little small, but big enough for 3 people to hang out in. The kitchen was small too, but sufficient. It was furnished with a fridge, stove oven, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, dining and cooking utensils. We were provided with paper towels, dishwashing and dishwasher detergent. There was no dining table. Thereâ€™s a small counter by the kitchen that had 2 chairs. In the bathrooms, there were shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste, bath and facial soaps. For other amenities such as lotions, you would have to request it from housekeeping. AMENITIES Shuttle The complimentary airport shuttle took so long. I called at 1:50pm and was told to wait on the 2nd level (departure area) for the shuttle. At 2:17pm, there was no shuttle so I called to follow up. I was told that the driver was dropping off some guests at the airport and picking up someone else too arriving from another airline. The shuttle didnâ€™t arrive until 2:30 and we got to the hotel at 2:37pm. It was a little easier to get a shuttle coming from the hotel. The shuttles ran every half hour and provided free service within 2 miles of the hotel I believe. Just call to make sure thereâ€™s a shuttle available. We took the shuttle to Publix not knowing that it was just one block away! The driver was nice enough to not complain and laughed with us when we realized how close it was. He said we can call the hotel for pick-up, but we walked back to the hotel. Internet There was complimentary wireless internet access in the room and the speed was okay. Breakfast Complimentary breakfast buffet was available M-F 6am-9:30am and Sa-Su 6am-10am. The selections were very good compared to most complimentary hotel breakfasts. They had 2 kinds of scrambled eggs, ham, oatmeal with selection of toppings, cereals, fruits, yogurt, muffins, bread, bagels, toast, milk, juice, coffee and more. Other complimentary amenities/services that we werenâ€™t able to avail of were the Evening Social (appetizers, wine, beer) available M-Th 5:30pm-7pm, grocery delivery service, 24-hour fitness center, pool and BBQ area with grills.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: wholelottaworld
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay at the summerfield suites and was really impressed with the hotel overall. The accomodations are fantastic catering for everyones needs. Ours was a one bedroom suite with seperate living area with full size fridge freezer, cooker, microwave etc. the living room was spacious airy and had t.v. and dvd player. The bathroom was nice and airy, connected to the bedroom. The AC was fantastic and very quiet. Although only minutes from MIA, there was no noise from the aircraft. The pool area is lovely and clean and they supply pool towels for you to use. A wonderful selection of food is served at there hot buffet breakfast and you can dine indoors or outdoors. Mon to Thurs there is a complimentary managers buffet where you get free wine, beer and nibbles to tide you over until dinner time (served 5.30 to 7) We chose this hotel for a 2 night stay inbound to Miami, to recover from jet lag before collection of our hire car from the airport. The hotel provides free shuttle bus to and from the airport, but remember to phone them to let them know you are at the transportation area for pickup. Our drivers were great at giving helpful info on how to exit and enter the airport when picking and returning the car, which we found invaluable as would of not had a clue how to get out of this huge airport. Front staff are friendly and Dax the manager is a lovely guy, approachable and helpful. Would recommend for layovers, business travelers and vacationers (although a little outside of South Beach attractions, still acessible by car or local transport) Shops around the back of the hotel offer range of needs, food, beer wine etc and there are the usual fast food restaurants and coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for a layover at the Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: Nashville1
Reviews.Content: Our family had a layover at the Miami airport in November. I highly recommend this hotel. Our rooms were in effect two bedroom two bath apartments. The rooms and common areas were clean and in good condition. The staff was helpful with restaurant suggestions. Try Casa Juan in the adjacent shopping center for some great Cuban food. The shuttle to the airport left on schedule. The pick up shuttle only runs on 30 minute intervals. We just missed it when we came from baggage claim and had quite a wait. Had I known that I would have taken a cab (the cab stand is in a different area from the shuttle pick up). The breakfast was better than most hotel buffets. All in all a very good place to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bczican
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative comments from some other people. This hotel was one of the nicest we stayed in while visiting FL. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The Internet Wi-Fi connection was great - unlike that of other hotels we stayed at. The Business Center offered the free use of a printer. From 5:30 - 7 p.m. the hotel serves free wine & beer along with an ample selection of food including soup, veggies, make your own nachos, etc. There is also a free breakfast and a small shopping area next to check-in with food you can cook in your room. Our room was clean and spacious and the bed very comfortable. The Manager introduced himself and checked to see if we needed anything. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “FtL boat show”
Reviews.Author: KalahariSong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the suites in FtL, close to the October 2011 boat show. The room was nice and spacious but the cleaner did miss a few spots here and there. Nothing too bad though. The airport shuttle was fantastic but the boat show transport service was more than shocking. The morning breakfast was delicious and the staff very friendly. Good value for your money

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and convenient for the airport”
Reviews.Author: fernga
Reviews.Content: A nice stop over for the airport, if you want to go to Ocean drive, the can will be about 35usd. The suites are lovely, spacious and comfortable with everything you could need. Highlt recommended

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: deenmatt
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this hotel based on the other reviews. But....altho the property was relatively newer...it was a little run down and tired. The hotel advertised a hotel shuttle. But when we called for a ride upon arrival at the airport, the shuttle was not a 24 hour shuttle so we had to pay for a taxi. It was not terribly expensive, just unexpected. The hotel "upgraded" our room to a 2 bedroom suite...that was handicapped accessible. Everything was positioned very low. Again, just a little inconvenient when you are 6'2". It smelled stale and musty. There were only 2 of us, so we never used the second bed/bath at all. I'm thinking the "upgrade" was really more of a "what was left" deal. The people at the front desk were very nice. They had a few convenience items by the front desk so we could have a snack since it was too late for dinner. Proximity to airport and cruise port was good. Didn't use the pool or free breakfast. Walking distance to grocery store and fast food restaurants. Very good transfers to the port arranged through the front desk. All in all....average.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: sboland22
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Priceline. The room was much better than expected. We ended up with a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. It was wonderful. The front desk staff were very helpful. They recommended a nearby cuban restaurant (within 5 min walk) that was good... not great, but good food at a reasonable price. They provided free shuttle service from the airport (and arrived on time). There was a shuttle available to take us to the Cruise port the next am also ($12 pp). The gym equipment was of great quality also. Breakfast is also included and had a good selection. Cons: our room was on the 1st floor. We did not hear any overhead traffic, but could hear traffic noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover, here's the place”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: If youÂ´re looking for a place for a no-mistake-stopover in MIA, thats the place. Altought its an airport hotel, its quite quiet. Calm neighborhood, from the spacious, clean & very well equiped large room, you can not hear all the planes noises. Free net, free shuttle, parking and breakfast is a plus. But the breakfast could be more "Hyatt" and less "free" face. But already booked my next MIA stopover and I"ll be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight”
Reviews.Author: Carolin L
Reviews.Content: This is a typical affordable airport hotel, it offers breakfast and a shuttle. The rooms were pleasant enough, although not furnished with the highest quality items and beggining to show wear. It was spacious and the bed's comfortable - make no mistake, this is not luxery and I would not make this a destination hotel. The breakfast was passable, as was the happy hour. On the morning of our departure, only one staff member was available to re-stock the breakfast items and clean the tables. This meant no plates, bowls, dirty tables and depleted food items (no pastries, etc.) I asked the front desk staff to change a large bill, they were unable to assist. I asked if we could store an item at the hotel until our return in 7 days, they could not assist. Again, this is a basic one night stay airport hotel, if you do not expect too much, you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “didn't even stay”
Reviews.Author: mstru
Reviews.Content: checked in and the staff was nice. on our way to the room, not one of three housekeepers said hello, and there were two huge containers of trash by an exit inside the building. when we got to the room, we were happy with what we saw. the one bedroom suite was huge with a king size bed, flat screen tv, sofa, and full kitchen. it wasn't the newest property, but it would be fine. this all changed when i looked in the tub to find a huge roach. we went back to the front, and asked for a new room. the new room was worst! it had an awful rank odor. one of the tv's did not work, there were dirty pans in the oven, and small dead bugs in the kitchen. we left to find another hotel. when we returned to check out of the hotel, the staff said the bugs were "palmetto bugs" and they were local to florida. local or not, i stay at a few hotels and i have never seen bugs alive or dead at any hotel but this.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for the price paid..”
Reviews.Author: Tatas_79
Reviews.Content: After reading the tripadvisor reviews I recently stayed at the Hyatt Sumerfield Suites, I paid $202.00 for a 2 bdrm suite and the truth is that the hotel is totally overrated. I found that the carpet on the first floor to be filthy, wireless internet to be absurdly slow, cable tv with poor programming and an impoverished breakfast buffet.. overall the price dont match the quality. I wouldnt recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First and last time at a Hyatt Summerfield Suites”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaLima
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I was deceived by a Trip Advisor Rating. I don't understand why Hyatt Summerfield Suites - Miami Airport is rated "Top Ten" hotel in Miami. There are two good things I'd like to say about it: 1) The rooms are large 2) The rates are reasonable (US$ 119) Unfortunately these are the ONLY good things about it. I've stayed 8 nights at this hotel last August (2011) and I had many small problems that turned my stay into a very uncomfortable one. 1) I was given a handicapped room, although I didn't need one, with a broken shower handle. Had to change rooms the next day. 2) The garbage disposal device was not working. Maintenance fixed it. 3) There was an unidentifiable beep inside the room. I asked the front-desk to fix it, but no answer. The next night the beep was unbearable. The maintenance changed the living room fire alarm battery and it seemed that the problem was fixed. Some hours later, when was in bed, I heard a beep again. Someone else was sent up and this time he changed the bedroom fire alarm battery. How do the other hotels handle their fire alarm batteries? Do they all wait to the fire alarm start beeping in the middle of the night in order to change them? 4) If you stay in the first floor, facing the parking lot, you can hear every car going in and out during the night. It was also possible to hear people chatting or talking at cel phones near their cars. 5) I didn't see any security cameras in the corridors, but there were many pizza leaflets under my door every night. It means there were unknown people wandering the corridors and I didn't feel very safe. 6) The free breakfast was nice, but the place was many times untidy. Some days there were dozens of empty boxes outside the kitchen's door almost blocking the passage from the elevator to the breakfast area. None of this problems were terrible ones, but they all together made my stay an unforgettable one, unfortunately not in a good sense.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelherm
Reviews.Content: Very close from Miami Airport, CVS (24hrs open), Supermarkets and Restaurants. We stayed at this hotel to visit Miami. The hotel was 15-20mins from downtown Miami and the price was reasonable as it was bit far from Downtown. We were very happy with the stay at this hotel as given the reasonable price, we could go to Downtown Miami very easily. I would recommend this hotel anyone who wants to visit Miami with a car!

Reviews.Title: “Location was good”
Reviews.Author: paulsmith1960
Reviews.Content: I just needed a place to stay next to the airport and that was what I got Nice and easy to get to and all the amenities you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very nice for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen&Martin
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I have ever stayed at near an airport. We stayed here for only one night, but the two bedroom suite was large and clean and felt like a comfortable apartment. The breakfast area was clean, bright and attractive, the breakfast abundant and the staff at the front desk and for breakfast were friendly and helpful. Clearly, this is not a luxury property, but if you are looking for somewhere reasonably priced to stay and want to feel comfortable, well-looked after and enjoy a nice breakfast to boot, this is an excellent choice. And my daughter approved of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nlondon99
Reviews.Content: stayed here with 2 teenagers, 2 bed suite easily sleeps 6 adults and would fit 2 kids in aswell no problem. Loved the free evening buffet and drinks and breakfast included also. Shuttle to and from airport but don't forget to call when you arrive and arrange pick up point as the area where you are told to wait on website is huge, shuttle also takes you to restaurants , shops etc. Nice pool with towels. Would definately recommend. No aircraft noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MorningStarAK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family after a cruise. 6 adults in 2 bedroom suite had plenty of room. Very comfortable and quiet. Stayed on the backside ground floor. Didn't hear any airport noise, traffic or river/canal traffic. Ducks in the back parking lot. Great Cuban restaurant in shopping area behind hotel, highly recommend - hotel shuttle will take you there and pick you up, but is within walking distance. While waiting for our room to be ready, since we were there before 10 a.m., we lounged by the pool, went to the grocery store and bought lunch food for everyone and had lunch in the pavillion. Then we were free to use the pool until our room was ready. Front desk stored our baggage when we arrived. Very nice, pleasant experience. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosaziglar
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the late and were greeted by very nice staff. We had a medical delima and the staff were quick to assist in solving the issue and took us EVERYWHERE we wanted to go. I would advise taking a camera to get shots of the exterior building. Very well maintained and it backs to a canal, where you or the kids can see the local animal life. We really enjoyed our stay. It is a nice pre/post cruise hotel with shuttle service and free parking while on your cruise. Having already booked next year's cruise, I have also located another hyatt summerfield hotel. Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: ex3family
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with 3 children. The rooms were clean and roomy. The pool was nice and the complimentary breakfast and social hour were a bonus. The shuttle service to the airport was quick and easy. Highly recommend this location for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near airport & cruise”
Reviews.Author: kib57
Reviews.Content: We flew down the night before a cruise. Stayed here because of the extra room, and proximity to both the airport and cruise. Very comfortable and spacious room. Very helpful front desk staff. Airline lost my luggage and delivered it to the wrong hotel. Stephanie at front desk called hotels in the area until she located my bag. Shuttle driver then took me to the other hotel and back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Place for Family Airport Stopover”
Reviews.Author: trolli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in early April with 2 Adults / 2 T(w)eens in a 2 BR-Suite. Very easy to find by car from Car-Rental-Centre, it took us less than 10 minutes, parking is free and we were greeted by very friendly and helpful Staff. I had requested a quiet room as we are light sleepers and I knew we would be tired after our flight from London. We were allocated a Suite facing out towards the back (Publix way) on the top floor towards the end of the corridor, away from almost all noise, I did not hear any planes, although DS said he heard the odd one, but it did not bother him . The Suite was very clean and more than spacious enough for the 4 of us and incl. kitchen and 2 bathrooms, which is handy when travelling with 2 t(w)eens, it was clean and the A/C worked quite well. We had a quick dip in the small, clean pool (towels provided) and went to sleep. There is no restaurant onsite, but you get a basic breakfast and they have a small shop where you can purchase drinks (incl wine/beer), snacks and ready-meals. Publix and Starbucks plus a few restaurants/Fast Food are a 5 minute walk away. If you are looking for a stopover after/before a flight, especially when travelling with more than 2 Adults and you want more than 1BR, I would recommend this place 100%. If we ever come back to Miami we will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Could've been brilliant...”
Reviews.Author: Craigbutler1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at the very beginning of April for business as I was working nearby and could not get in to the hotel across the road. Good points: - Friendly, attentive staff. - Nicely appointed rooms. - Decent selection of TV Channels. - Close to restaurants/supermarket. - Decent wireless Internet access. Bad points: - Poor selection of hot food at breakfast. - Incredibly loud toilets, gives the impression the walls are paper thin! Much louder than the toilets on the airplane that I arrived on! - When you ask for a quiet room, you usually expect a quiet room. You expect plane noise.. but Jet Ski's going up and down the river behind the hotel, and no double-glazing/sound insulation whatsoever... which... for a hotel virtually on top of an airport.. is a bit amazing. I've stayed in the Sofitel across the road and not had these issues previously. If you put this hotel anywhere else, away from the location it is in... then it would be absolutely amazing value and would not hesitate to recommend it. But the noise issues mean I wouldn't dream of doing so. If I could give sleep quality a zero rating, I would've done so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AndyJoManchester
Reviews.Content: We hired a 1 bedroom suite as we were travelling with a 6 month old baby and needed a kitchen. The rooms were big, with a kitchen, lounge, bedroom, wlakthrough closet area and bathroom. We stayed at the start and the end of our holiday - at the start our room overlooked the pool and we did not hear any airport noise. On the second visit our room was at the front and we did hear planes, however not really after 10pm. The breakfast is ok, does the job but not loads of choice. The evening "social" - free wine, nibbles was great and was from 5.30 to 7pm Mon - Thurs. Location wise it was great as you could get on the main highway 2 streets down. I would throughly recommend this hotel, however not sure how much nightlife there is within walking distance, may be mest to elsewhere if you want this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for overnight near airport.”
Reviews.Author: fs5
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on ratings from other Tripadvisor members. We had an overnight stay in Miami after a cruise before an early morning flight out of MIA. There were 5 of us traveling (husband and I and our 19 year old daughter and her 2 friends), so we reserved the 2 bedroom king suite through the hotels website. Since our cruise was arriving early, I had requested an early check in on my reservation. We took a taxi from the port of Miami to the hotel, arriving at about 10 am. Upon arrival, the front desk clerk informed us that we couldn't do early check in, as nothing was available yet and that the room was guaranteed available at 3:00. We were kind of bummed but we knew our early check in request wasn't guaranteed. The front desk clerk offered to store our bags for us until our room became available. Not wanting to hang around until our room was ready, we inquired about car rentals in the area, and the front desk clerk said they had a car rental company that they worked with. She got them on the phone for us, and we were able to rent a car-they came and picked us up for about a 5 minute drive to the rental car location. Renting the car went smoothly and they told us to return it, just gas it up and leave it locked up in the hotel parking lot and give the keys in the provided envelope to the front desk clerk. Easy! We went shopping for a couple hours and returned back to the hotel at 1:00 hoping our room might be available, as we were tired and wanted to rest and freshen up. No room available yet. The girls were tired and needed to do some class work, and the front desk clerk offered them use of the pool area to wait for our room to be available. The girls decided to do that, so the hubby and I went and had lunch. We got back at 3:00 and now our room was ready. Rooms were large with a small full kitchen. Beds were very comfortable. Only thing wrong in the room was that the door to the bathroom in our room couldn't close easily because it was too tight and scraped the floor. But it was no big deal. Overall, the rooms were really comfortable. After a quick nap, hubby and I went out to tour around Miami while the girls stayed and napped. They girls ended up ordering pizza while we were gone, and we went out for a nice Italian dinner at Il Forno Ristorante. (EXCELLENT MEAL!) We went to bed in the comfy king size bed and got up at 5:45 in the morning to get ready for our 8:30 am flight out of MIA. Woke the girls up and found that all three slept in the other King bed. I asked why someone didn't sleep on the hide-a-bed sofa, they said it was because there were no bedding for it (pillow, sheets, blanket). I told them they should have contacted the front desk to ask for some, but they said they didn't want to bother. We got down to the lobby at 6:15 to have a bit of breakfast before we took the hotel provided shuttle to Miami airport. The breakfast options were great: cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries, bagels, hot scrambled eggs, juices etc. The hotel shuttle arrived at 6:30 (it leaves every half hour) and took us for a short ride to MIA. Overall, I really liked our experience here. The ammenites provided are really good at a decent price, and if we are ever in need of an airport close to MIA again, I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option near Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: Ruth11111111
Reviews.Content: We spent one night when arriving from vegas and before getting on a cruise. The hotel has a transfer from and to Miami Airport. It is about 7 minutes drive. It has an excellent breakfast included in the price. I booked a two bedroom suite, because I travelled with husband and my 3 sons. Very clean and complete. Very kind and helpful staff. For people that has to spend one or two nights in the area is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “great value stover”
Reviews.Author: galloise43
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel after flying into Miami airport. I was amazed at size of accommodation and warmth of welcome. The whole suite consisted of kitchen,lounge area and separate bedroom. It was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. A complimentary social hour with drinks and nibbles was provided, together with abuffet breakfast all included in the price'! Incredible value for money Very conveniet for the airport with shuttle transfers to airport .Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel from our trip”
Reviews.Author: webster117
Reviews.Content: We also stayed at the Hyatt in Miami by the bay during our trip but this was the most comfortable hotel. The rooms are so spacious, perfect for families and longer stays. The hotel is close to the airport. It felt like home. The beds were comfy, the breakfast was delicious and the service from the staff at the front desk was superb. We would definitely return to this hotel. Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stopover in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked on PL for 46$. The room was huge, 2 bedrooms with king beds, a nice living room, a well appointed kitchen, LCD TVs in all rooms (so 3 TVs!)....I could have stayed there for a while. There is a shopping plaza close by with a supermarket and nice latino restaurants. Shuttle service was efficient. I would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: Jabbawoki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our arrival to Miami, we then travelled around Florida for a week and then returned to this hotel for a further 6 nights. We found the stay excellent on both occasions. We stayed in a two bed room suite which was very clean and spacious. The breakfast was good and they also serve snacks in the evenings, Mon-Thurs, which are quite substantial, including soup, chilli, crisps, salad etc and wine. We particularly enjoyed the pool which was lovely and warm. The location, whilst not at the centre of all the action, was conveniently located for access to the airport and for major road links, making it easy to travel around. Given it's proximity to the airport there was limited noise disruption. We would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to others, we had a lovely room and excellent service, all in all it was really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel3004
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed one night prior to a holiday cruise. We requested an early check-in when we made the reservation and the hotel upgraded our room type to accommodate us. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The shuttle was quick to pick us up from the airport, and they offer complimentary shuttle service to restaurants close by. The shuttle driver was very knowledgable about the area and very friendly. The room was great. The pool was fantastic, we had a very relaxing day. The night we stayed they offered a small buffet of appetizers, soup and salad. We would choose this hotel again for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the right boxes”
Reviews.Author: rednblackexile
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Hyatt for one night on arrival at Miami, before heading down to the Keys, largely based on other reviews but also because of the room configuration. Based on previous experience of jet lag, the chances were that at least one of us would be up during the night and having the separate living area would provide a safe haven. As it happens we all slept through! Suite was clean and very comfortable, with plenty of space for the 5 of us. Breakfast average but adequate. Location mainly nomansland but 15 minutes in the car on one straight road and we were in South Beach eating at a great Italian. Perfect for an overnight airport stop.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Summerfield Miami Airport is not a friendly place at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: bucnasty360
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on the internet. The fact that I'm taking precious time away from my family to submit this review should assist those who read this in understanding just how serious this review is. I'll start on a positive note: On 12/5/10, I stayed at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites Miami Airport with my wife and my 2 year old. The hotel was clean enough and it was literally 2 minutes from Miami International Airport. We also had good customer service from the initial desk clerk (Annie). NOW FOR THE BAD: Where do I begin? Nobody at the door offered to assist us with our 6 bags of luggage when we exited the taxi. I previously confirmed an early check-in prior to arrival, however, the room was not ready and we had to wait for 1 & 1/2 hours for it to be prepared. We requested a crib and they brought us a pack-and-play, which would have been fine if it wasn't BROKEN! Their website indicated they offered complimentary shuttle service within a 2-mile radius, however, upon asking to go to the nearest shopping center (within 2 miles) we were told it would cost $10. While attempting to take a nap in the afternoon, there was a loud sound, like a commercial washing machine in cycle, coming from the walls. I contacted the front desk and was told they would check into it, then call me back. They never called and the sound never stopped, so there went our nap. Tried to take a bath, but the drain stop was broken and rusted! Around 10 PM, we attempted to go to sleep (6 AM departure flight and all...) and the sound started again. I went down to the front desk and VERY respectfully requested to talk to the manager on duty. A female came from the back and IMMEDIATELY began speaking to me in a condescending tone stating, "There is no washers or dryers close to your room. I don't know what you're hearing." - Verbatim. I kept my cool and asked that someone come to the room and listen for themselves. The manager called someone on a walkie-talkie. A security guard came to the desk and she began speaking to him in Spanish about me, not realizing that with 4 years of Spanish I can understand certain things, as well as the fact that it was rude behavior also. Anyways, to make a long story short, you'll pay about $140 for crappy customer service (unless it's Annie), a sub-par setting, loud noises to keep you awake, and have to deal with front desk managers who are rude, disdainful, and antagonistic. Oh yeah, that would be front desk manager Linda Guzman. Hope this helps somebody avoid the disaster we just experienced. Hope you have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want shuttle service from the airport!”
Reviews.Author: HoosTravelin
Reviews.Content: I had two problems with this hotel. The main issue was the shuttle service. I was EXTREMELY disappointed/dissatisfied with the shuttle service from the airport. We arrived in Miami Thanksgiving night (around 8:45pm), as we were going on a cruise the next day. Once we landed, I called the hotel to inquiry about pickup times. The clerk (don't know her name) said the driver would be there in 10 minutes (9:00 run) and if we missed him, he would be back in 30 minutes. My wife and I went outside to the shuttle pickup area (the departure level) and waited for OVER AN HOUR for the shuttle that never came! We probably saw a shuttle for every other hotel chain drive through that area multiple times, without seeing HSS once. I even asked the airport personnel to call the hotel (twice), and they were told that a shuttle was coming but couldn't give him a time. The airport guy even told us that HHS shuttles didn't come regularly. Wish I would've known that beforehand. We eventually gave up, after 10:00pm and took a cab to the hotel. It was late and it didn't make sense for us to continue waiting for a shuttle that never showed up, while seeing other hotel shuttles coming by so often. The main reason for choosing this hotel, and not the Hyatt downtown, was because of the supposedly free shuttle service from the airport! And to make matters worse, when we finally got to the hotel via taxi, of course the shuttle is sitting right outside. Unfortunately, upon checking in the hotel and explaining the situation and expressing some frustration, the clerk barely apologized and didn't offer us anything to make up for the lack of service. It was nice to hear that one of the other reviewers was at least upgraded to a larger room. That would have been nice, but luckily we were only going to be there for one night. The second problem (albeit minor) was with our TV in the living area of the suite. While the TV in the bedroom worked fine, the one in the living room was stuck on TBS and you could not change the channel with the remote on on the TV itself. There was no way to turn the channel on that TV, because the problem was with the TV and not with the remote. I asked the front desk for assistance and they said the guy couldn't help us at that moment, but could help later in the night. It was already late, since we arrived later than expected because of the lack of shuttle service, so I told him to forget it, since we were only staying overnight. Real quick - the quality of the room itself was fine and there were no complaints from that standpoint. Check-in and out were smooth as well. I tend to agree with the previous reviewers overall (including the loud flushing). If you rent a car, and need to stay near the airport, then you will probably be fine and happy with the accommodations. Unfortunately, I probably would not stay here again because there are other choices near the airport (if needed) that I believe are more reliable. And if we rent a car next time, as we have done in the past, we would most likely stay downtown or at the beach. As my title states, this hotel is suitable so long as you are not counting on (or need) the shuttle service. If so, choose elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel Very Close to MIA”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie
Reviews.Content: Unable to get the flight we wanted returning from the Caribbean on the 12th of Nov., we needed a place to stay for one night enroute to Philadelphia on 11/13. We chose the HSS for proximity to the airport since our flight was out pretty early the next morning and wanted a property offering a shuttle. There were only two hitches we encountered (and they were minor) for our stay. The first was the slowness in having the shuttle pick us up at the airport. It took 2 or 3 phone calls (and more than a l/2 hour) to be picked up. When we did arrive at the hotel, the check in was smooth and the desk could not have been nicer to us, and very apologetic for the wait. In fact, they were nice enough to upgrade us to a two bedroom and two bathroom suite. This was most appreciated as my husband had gotten a pretty nasty cold and he was glad to have a bedroom and bath of his ''own'' in which to suffer and recuperate! The hotel also offered shuttle service to guests to nearby restaurants and we took advantage of this service (actually close enough to walk, but we decided we were a little too beat). We took the recommendation of the shuttle driver and desk person and went to eat dinner at the Cuban restaurant at the nearby shopping center and it was phenomenal and reasonable. HEARTILY recommend this place. The suite was simply beautiful. It was large with a full kitchen and comfy living room, nicely furnished and we felt it was a shame we could not take advantage of the amenities, but a family or group would find this place ideal--full size fridge, stove, dishwasher, etc., small dining space, etc. The suite was immaculately clean, the bedrooms and living area all had large flat screens. The beds were extremely comfortable too. We had no complaints whatsoever about the suite, it was great. The second small issue was the breakfast. It's great to have the opportunity to take advantage of an included breakfast, but we did not have the time before our flight to do that, so I thought we could run in and pick up some kind of wrapped bagel or muffin and perhaps a banana or yogurt to bring to the airport with us. There were no 'grab and go' food opportunities that I could see, so the only thing we could take advantage of was the coffee machine in our suite. Other than these two minor glitches, I cannot say enough about this place and heartily recommend the Hyatt Summerfield Suites near Miami airport wholeheartedly. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hope your neighbor doesn`t flush during the night!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: Clean,handy hotel close to Airport,large rooms,full kitchen,good breakfast. The only thing bad about the hotel is the noise when somebody flushes.Sometimes it looks like as a plane taking off!!!Hotel should check this plumbing issue!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gailieb
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location (close to the airport). We found our room (2 bedroom) to be very clean, beds were great, and it was very quiet. Loved the pool as well. Stayed only one night on our way to Curacao. Folks at the front desk were very great. The buffet in the morning was excellent, lots to choose from and quality ingredients. One thing we thought could be improved was the shuttle service. When I inquired about the shuttle I was told to phone when we arrived at the airport. Well, trying to find a pay phone was almost impossible, then after 3 calls that wouldn't go through, I had to ask if I had to include the area code when calling the hotel. Nowhere did it say to include the area code. Folks from out of town would no doubt find this quite annoying. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay As Good As the First”
Reviews.Author: NFlorida55
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this hotel; the night before flying out from Miami Airport. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a one night before or after a flight.The hotel allows you to leave your car on their property and they have a great shuttle service to and from airport. The staff is very friendly and the suites are very clean. They have snacks and drinks in the evening and a good breakfast which is all included. It is in walking distance to some resturants as well; or they will shuttle you to the mall which is in the area. I don't think we would stay anywhere else when we are in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel - Easy Location”
Reviews.Author: Canesfan16
Reviews.Content: This is a good business travelers hotel. It obviously gets a lot of use but is in pretty good shape. Breakfast buffet is decent, social hour M-Tr is good. Appetizer type food and beer/wine. Full kitchens in room well stocked, TVs are good, but no HD feed and limited channels. Grills available in patio area, pool is there but nothing special. Overall a good choice in the area, easy location and competitive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a group of people in one room, not great quality though”
Reviews.Author: wayne_wz
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Hyatt Summerfield Suite hotel. I'll probably never stay there again. Another Nice hotel chain opens up a Motel 6. Cheap furniture, cheap beds, thin walls. This location was good for the airport, but next to a really bad neighborhood in Miami. Stay north or east of the airport. The only redeeming values: value when you have more than a few people in one room. (also, the breakfast is no even worth eating!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kayotic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Summerfield Suite for the first night of our honeymoon before leaving for our cruise and it was a wonderful stay. There was a mix up about the shuttle picking us up, and so when we called they sent the driving back immediately for us. When we arrived for check in, they were so apologetic and gave us a goodie back filled with snacks and waters and other goodies. That really impressed me. The rooms were beautiful and clean. After traveling for 12 hours we were ready to relax and the rooms were so cozy and welcoming. The front desk was very helpful and really made us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AKhowa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and orderly. All staff encountered were friendly and helpful. The breakfast and evening social food items were fresh and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient to cruise port”
Reviews.Author: MShanNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to leaving for a cruise out of the Port of Miami. Check-in was a breeze and the rooms were wonderful -- nicely decorated and clean! There was a kitchen, living room, and bedroom, and flat screen TV's. The place was quiet and I got a good night's sleep! The front desk recommended some local places to eat and offered some menus for take-out. We walked to a local Italian place to get food. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family that were looking for a pre-cruise hotel. The hotel also offered a van to the Port in the morning. I traveled here with my boyfriend and we're young (late 20's) if that matters... We were alone, but I could see this room holding a family of 4-5 easily -- especially if you had two beds with the living room sofa I DO NOT recommend using the shuttle service vans they offer at Fort Lauderdale Airport to get here though (GO Shuttle I think?). It took THREE hours because we were the last stop and the driver could not find the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent food (breakfast and evening) and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: mabehe
Reviews.Content: Although I had a room on the top floor (3rd) next to a 6 lane road I could not hear any traffic and could not hear the airplanes. There is a hot breakfast - real eggs and meat (sausage/bacon) plus the assorted cereal (hot and cold), fruit, yoghurt and breakfast rolls. The hospitality in the evening (M-H) is beer and wine with chili, b b q, chicken wings lots of dips, bread, chips, soup. The rooms have a full kitchen with a full size refrig, flat top stove, oven, microwave and breakfast bar, living room with a comfortable couch and foot rest with a flat screen TV. The bedroom is separate, with a door, another TV. This hotel even provides a small tube of toothpaste. Well stocked exercise room and business office with 4 computers. The pool is not crowded and the hot tub is very comfortable temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Luizhcr
Reviews.Content: My wife and me were planninh a baby shopping trip to miami with both mothers. Instead of booking two rooms in a regular hotel I found the idea of a suite very interesting. I chose Hyatt following the reviews in trip advisor and couldnÂ´t have chosen better. We stayed for a week in a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen and living room, had planty of space to large boxes and luggage. The breakfast and late brunch (complimentary) are very nice and the hotel is very well located near the airport (no aircraft noise), we went to a lot of stores in florida 35 miles up and down the hotel with no trouble at all. I recomend the hotel for tripadvisor users.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite, great services.”
Reviews.Author: shelter
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites Miami Airport in april 2010. The suite was large : one spacious room with sofa bed and flat screen and a kitchen (with big fridge, stove with oven, micro-wave, dishwasher, toaster), a bedroom with king size bed and another flat screen and a bathroom with one part with bathtub combo and toilet and another one with washbowl and wardrobe. The hotel has a pool with pretty gardens and offers a complimentary hot breakfast buffet and a complimentary social hour with soda, beer, dips... We were very satisfied with the hotel services, the hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport when we arrived and drove us to our rental car location the next day. We asked by fax to get the sofa bed ready for our son as our flight arrived late, it was done. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed: Very modern”
Reviews.Author: Navytravler
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay there based on reviews that I read. The wife and I were very pleased with our large King bed room. It was on the first floor and close to the front desk. We did not notice any outside noise and the twin flat screen TV's were a nice touch. The lack of an in house restaurant was a let down, but they do have a little mini-shop next to the front desk. You can buy some microwavable meals and snacks/toiletries 24/7. The front desk staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. We arrived and checked in at 10pm with fast, friendly service. They even recommended a local restaurant that was open late for us to try. The restaurant (Casa Juan) was fantastic. The complementary breakfast was pretty good. Not as good as the Embassy Suites Airport hotel also in Miami, but better than most. There was eggs, sausage, and pancakes on the hot side and the standard muffins/cereal/fruit choices on the other side. The hotel is about a 8-10 minute walk from the nearest fast-food/retail area. If you are looking for a more modern, business-ish, professional feeling place to stay then this is it. I would stay here again no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: bigfootup
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online about 6 months prior via Hotwire for about $60. Free shuttle service from the airport was prompt, and each family was checked into a spacious one bedroom suite with a full kitchen and living room with a Queen size sofa sleeper, and a separate bedroom with King size bed. The hotel featured a nice outdoor pool and grilling facilities in an interior courtyard, and a full and free breakfast buffet in the morning. Next door, but a couple block walk away is a strip mall with grocery store, liquor store, Italian restaurant, and a fantastic Cuban restaurant! You can walk, or the hotel will shuttle you on request. The hotel offers to arrange shuttle service to the Cruise Port for $15/person. We called around and found cheaper without any trouble. The service from each and every staff member was friendly, personal, and professional. This is the best lodging value, with the best service that I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Beware..you could be bumped to another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: moncton
Reviews.Content: I had chosen the Hyatt Summerfield as it was #3 out of 139 hotels on the recommended hotels in Miami on Tripadvisor.I had read all the positive reviews and knew this was the hotel we wanted for our 3 night precruise mini vacation. Upon arrival at the Hotel, at aprox. 3pm on the 29th April,we were told there was a "water problem" at the hotel and that they were moving us to the Homewood Suites Miami-Airport West for our 3 night stay. We were extremely upset to say the least! Other people were checking into the hotel as we were being turned away,and we were told they were part of a group booking,even though they did not appear to us to be.I wondered later if they had just "overbooked" the hotel as there we no service vehicles to be seen around the hotel. While the Homewood was more than adequate for a one night stay,it was not good for a 3 day mini vacation as it was directly in a flight path for the airport and was extremely noisy in the pool area because of this. The Hyatt did pay for one of our 3 nights at the Homewood,but it did not make up for our disappointment....we did not have the quiet ,relaxing precruise stay that we wanted :(

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Getawaygal43
Reviews.Content: This was a business/leisure trip as we were pre-viewing several hotels in the area for an upcoming pre-cruise group event and also celebrating an anniversary. We stayed here at the Suites for one night and at another more upscale/luxury property downtown our second night. I must say that we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. There is no grand lobby or anything but the decor and ambiance is very nice and quaint. The staff was friendly and courteous. The rooms were very nicely appointed and clean. The beds were also comfortable. It was great having the full kitchen as they delivered a nice welcome platter of cold cuts and crackers to the room (nice touch). The breakfast was also good. The only thing that I missed at breakfast was waffles which they didn't offer. But they provided eggs, pancakes (which needed a little help) potatoes, meats, fruit, cereal, bagels, toast, juices, coffee, teas etc. The location was very nice, having a Publix supermarket, Subway, Burger King, a Chinese and Italian restaurant and an Office supply store and a Nail shop at a nearby shopping center. CVS, Walgreens, Mcdonald's and Wendys were also nearby and within walking distance. We felt safe in the area as this hotel sits within a very nice office park area. Overall, we had a great stay here and would highly recommend it to others. We are already making arrangements to come back with our pre-cruise group.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayr0ad
Reviews.Content: While close to the Miami airport, the hotel is in an office park setting that was both park-like and secure. The staffer who checked me in was one of the most helpful I have encountered as he took the time to explain (without me asking) about nearby restaurants, convenience stores, etc. Rooms are first rate (I was upgraded to a 2BR suite and it was wonderfully spacious). There are wall-mounted flat screen TVs, although there were no HD channels. Wireless Internet was easy to connect too, although no quicker than the 3G speed on my iPhone. The free extras (evening happy hour and morning breakfast) were both great. The courtyard area around the pool looked inviting although I didn't have the time to sample it. The hotel is just a few miles from the airport terminal, although it's closer than that runway 9/27, the lengthiest runway at the airport and the one used by the larger passenger and cargo planes. But, I found that the noise was not unacceptable and otherwise you couldn't hear any street or traffic noise. The hotel offers easy access to the Dolphin Expressway and depending on traffic, you can get to Miami Beach in 15 minutes or so. The hotel emailed a guest survey to me which I completed. I later received a thank you email from the assistant general manager, a nice personal touch. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: pat1030
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because we were going to a concert at Jackie Gleason Theatre in Miami Beach and were flying out the next morning. We had a car so we could have stayed in Miami Beach but since we were only there for the concert it seemed like the hotels in MB would be a waste of $.
