We were greeted and immediately upgraded to a 2 BR suite with kitchen. I only have 2 small complaints-the room we were assigned the AC was broken but they moved us to another and all was good. The second thing was no icemachines. I guess this is because it has a fridge with icemaker but when we arrived there was no ice; maybe they throw it out after each guest. We started it up and had ice when we returned from our concert. We didn't have time for happy hour or breakfast so I can't comment on those. Overall a good value if you need a place to stay by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The best 3-star hotel I've found.”
Reviews.Author: Awolinsaudi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start of a 2 week Florida vacation. Was so good we came back without hesitation prior to flying out of Miami. Staff excellent, got good rate, rooms impeccable, amenities very good. Free extras like the happy hour and breakfast most welcome. The hotel couldn't have been more helpful to all the guests stranded due to air travel disruptions.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: NFlorida55
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hyatt Summerfield before our flight from Miami. It is a great location for the airport. The shuttle bus is less then 5 minutes from the airport. The social hour at night was very nice with wine, beer and light snacks out. The breakfast in the morning also has a nice selection. The front desk clerk when we checked in was very friendly and upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite. He also suggested a great Italian resturant that was a very short walk and we had a great dinner! Even with being so close to the airport there was no noise at all. The room was very clean and bed very comfortable. When we got back from our vacation we called the hotel and the shuttle bus was there to pick us up within 10 minutes and no problem with leaving our car at the hotel while away. I have stayed many times at hotels before or after a flight and I must say this probably was the most plesant experience and would recommend this hotel to everyone. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. Good job Hyatt Summerfield!!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: youngmotherhubbard
Reviews.Content: We booked one night here following a flight from the UK. It is a perfect place for a short stay due to proximity to the airport. We were delighted with the complimentary social hour and breakfast and were extremely pleased with our comfortable two bedroomed suite. This was convenient for our family with two children. We were so pleased with our stay that we changed our plans and booked a further nights stay before coming home. One tip: request a pool facing room. For our second stay we faced the airport and we were aware that this was a much noisier location in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful end to a cruise”
Reviews.Author: KimleeSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel although I've stayed in other Summerfield's which is why I chose them. In addition to being big Hyatt fans as we are assured a level of quality. We were there for three days after a crusie and having the room to stretch out a bit was a plus. The room was great and even though there was a kitchen, we were satisfied with the continental breakfast provided each morning. The happy hour each evening was great start to dinner on the town. The weather was a bit uncooperative so it was nice to have a comfortable place to rest when we couldn't get out. Surprisingly quiet even with being next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Great”
Reviews.Author: RichWoodinville
Reviews.Content: We found the Summerfield suites to be an excellent and convenient place to stay either before or after a cruise from Miami. Only problem was with suggested outside restaurant, Mamma Caruso's which delivered the wrong order, charged $37 for a sandwich and a salad and was rude when asked to fix the problem--which they didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay After A Cruise”
Reviews.Author: havingfun42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days after a cruise. We had a 2 bedroom king non-smoking it was a very nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet business district right off the freeway. They have a gym, free breakfast, nice pool area, free wireless in the rooms, 4 computers and printer in the business center and a laundry room. We cruise once a year and I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: amiel32
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research before deciding to stay near the airport. It was our first time in Miami and I wanted to stay on the beach but I did not want to deal with all night partiers during spring break. I used my AAA discount and got a great rate on this hotel and decided to go with it. The staff was friendly, the location is good, the rooms (suites) were spacious and clean. There was a full kitchen with cooking utensils, full fridge/freezer, oven, microwave, dishwasher, 2 flat screens (one was in the bedroom), a dvd player, comfy bed, and a business center with access to internet, Microsoft office applications, and a printer. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Even though the hotel is by the airport it was not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place---we would go back.”
Reviews.Author: duncanboy1
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice and clean and in a safe area. The breakfast in the morning was more then what most hotels offer for free (eggs, meat, fruit salad etc). My only complaint was we checked in at 3 PM and the room was not ready. We left and came back about an hour later and it was still not ready. We did not get the room till 5 PM...that was the only disappointment here.

Reviews.Title: “Space and excellence for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chagoule
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. The shuttle from/to the airport is convenient and flexible. Yes, it is an airport hotel and you need a car but it takes you 10 minutes to Downtown or Coral Gables, 20 minutes to South Beach at most. It is worth mentioning that parking is free, a rarity in Miami. For the two of us we ended in a suite with two independent bedrooms, two bathrooms, a lounge, a fully equipped kitchen, 3 flat screen TVs, a DVD player. Not only it was big for two, but it was very clean and comfortable. Overall, the hotel itself is in good condition. On the third day we had to call maintenance to replace burnt bulbs and this was done in the instant. The included buffet breakfast is better than in many places with juices, good coffee, tea, breads, pastries and a choice of hot items such as eggs, sausages, bacon. Service is attentive. Replenishment of the buffet is done properly so that all choices of the day are always available. When you are at the hotel between 5 and 7 p.m.you are welcome to enjoy what they call the complimentary Evening Social with drinks (beer, wine, sodas) and appetizers, a good way to slacken and to prepare for the evening. Unlike most airport hotels where you end in the middle of nowhere, here you are at a 5-minute walk of a small shopping center including Publix supermarket, CVS pharmacy, Starbucks, Subway, BurgerKing and 2 minute more to Wendy's and Mc Donald's. It was our first experience with the Hyatt Summerfield Suites and it was highly conclusive. A lot of space, a friendly staff, an excellent value : it is a choice that we will always consider for our next trips.

Reviews.Title: “Really good airport hotel! Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: scoobyrix
Reviews.Content: stayed one night before a cruise. Reception staff very friendly and helpful and we were upgraded ( didn't ask!) and had a lovely 2 bed, 2 bath room with lounge and kitchen!!! Flat screen tvs x3 so no arguments about who's watching what... nice change...it was huge and very clean... almost as big as the downstairs of my home ;-) and made the cabin on the cruise ship seem even smaller than it was....beds very comfy. Was some aircraft noise but not so bad. Sadly it was too cold to use the pool, but it had just been cleaned and the hot tub was popular. Short walk to a few shops/restaurants which was nice even though you get some funny looks for walking in America!!!! Breakfast a pleasant inclusion in the price; not flash but better than average. Hotel arranged transport to port, but check price if more than 2 adults ($12 each) as may be cheaper to get taxi. We were quite sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently TOPS”
Reviews.Author: Paul_in_VA
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews for this hotel going back 4-5 years. They're all generally very good. The few complaints are minor and are the easily resolved kind. This is a rare thing in the hotel business, especially in Miami, home to many a crappy hotel. We've stayed here for a week every year for the last 5 years. We could pay 2x the price, but who needs that? Attractive property, beautifully maintained, an oasis, really. Not a resort but the pool is heated and the deck is tranquil. You DO need a car. 15 mins to Miami Beach, 20 mins to Key Biscayne,5 mins to downtown Miami, 10 mins to the best Cuban restaurants outside Havana. Free breakfast (plenty of hot items served buffet style), free parking (practically unheard of in Miami). Secure, gated property. Friendly, effecient staff (likewise rare in Miami). Everything ship-shape. Manager Sandra seems to work 12 hour days, and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good one!!!”
Reviews.Author: INTRAVLER
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before a cruise,and every time we take a cruise out of Miami we will be staying at this Hotel. When we got to the airport at baggage claim, we grabbed the bags and went up one floor (that's where the hotel shuttles are). I called the hotel, someone speaking English that you could understand said a shuttle would be there in 10 minutes and it was. The hotel is nice and clean, there is a lot of walking the hotel is spread out and only 3 floors , the hall way had a funny smell but the rooms were fine. Only a little airplane noise, there is a Publix grocery store just behind the hotel, short 5 minute walk. There is also a subway and bugerKing and Pizza delivery. The morning breakfast was great --cereals, yoguart, breads, eggs, frenchtoast, sausage, eggs, potatoes. Our room was a one bedroom suite, we had 5 people and everyone was comfortable. We asked the front desk to call a minivan cab and 3 minutes later we were loading up for the Port. I spent alot of time looking for a safe, nice , one night stay hotel before our cruise and I found a great one with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stop off hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This is a really convienent hotel for the airport. The shuttle service to and from the airport is excellent and flexible, they will take you to the car hire locations rather than the airport if requested. The room we had was large and clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a kitchen which was reasonably well equipped - but no kettle. The included breakfast was extremely good having a wide choice of well prepared food and drinks. We will certainly stay here again and much preferred it to the similarly priced Hampton Inn which is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dctwin
Reviews.Content: Although the location isnt that close to Miami Beach, it is close to the airport and has a shuttle to the airport so its worth it! Loved the Suites and everyone was nice. They have a great happy hour/ snack bar. I really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Loon no further”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: For a high quality, but low-cost Miami stay this is the place to be. For 150 USD incl. tax (AAA rate) we got: free airport transportation, upgrade from one king bedroom to two king bedroom suite, the supercozy Hyatt Grand Bed, free (but very slow) WiFi, a decent hot breakfast buffet, a shopping plaza right around the corner. Room was superspacious and quiet, nicely appointed. Shuttle arrived in no time. Parking would have been free, too. They even do your shopping for you at no fee at all. Sure, there's no view whatsoever, but having stayed at Marriott Biscayne Beach before, I must say: forget the view and stay here, because there's nothing around you in downtown Miami and you have to go everywhere by car as well - and have to pay a huge fee for parking on-site or for valet. So: next time we will stay here right away and use this comfortable, affordable place as our base for exploring the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, practical a good pre-flight base, close to Miami airport.”
Reviews.Author: Winton8
Reviews.Content: These are little suites that have a lounge/kitchen double bedroom and bathroom. We stayed for two nights at the end of a driving holiday to the Keys and gulf coast. Although near the airport the suites can be a little hard to find initially without a sat nav but in fact they run a courtesy bus service. The suites are quite well placed for several malls and there are some restaurants nearby and a Publix next door. Breakfast was complimentary with a good selection although a bit of scrum on one morning as a large party was booked in prior to a cruise. As you would expect there was plenty of free parking. The staff were polite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A HIDDEN GEM!!”
Reviews.Author: concertma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Summerfield the night before our anniversary cruise. Upon arrival at the Miami airport, we called the hotel and the shuttle (complimentary) arrived within 30 min. They allowed us an early check-in and even upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite w/kitchenette. It was roomy and clean and we had a TV in every room. (My husband LOVED that). The bed was comfortable. The next morning we had a wonderful breakfast buffet downstairs. There was NO reason to be hungry with the selection of food that was available! (also complimentary) The staff were all friendly and tried to meet our every need. Hyatt Summerfield in Miami is a hidden gem! We would definately return to stay with them again. ABSOLUTELY recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveller110
Reviews.Content: This Place has one of the best staff, and they do deserve a mention. We were there without a car, and the staff helped us by driving us around whenever we needed them. Sometimes when there was a problem the manager came herself to pick us/drop us. Also they were very flexible as we were not sure how long we would need to stay (coz of some problems) and they were very accomodative. They have a great breakfast and also a happy hour on weekdays, which was excellent too. And the rooms and service was great, and overall a clean and hygenic place

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Service”
Reviews.Author: alderion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise for one night leaving the next for more vacation in St. Maarten. The shuttle did NOT run every 15 minutes like the information staff at the airport will tell you. Once it did get there though the driver was very helpful with our bags etc. The hotel itself is obviously not terribly new but is well maintained and spacious. We were dissapointed with the service in the restaurant but they did have a party of about 20 show up unannounced so somewhat understandable I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite, toilet discharge too noisy”
Reviews.Author: sergej
Reviews.Content: Great Suites, Rooms are clean and spacious, location is okay, recommend to travel with a rental car or taxi(will cost you to get to places, better rent a car) Great place to stay, except that the toilet discharge, sounds very loud. So if someone is going to the toilet on the floor above you, you know when he/she has finished the job especially at night, but the suite has 2 flat screen TV. So after a long shopping day, there is no need to fight for the remote. The rooms are very clean. will give them a 9 out of 10. Breakfast is not that great, it is a simple breakfast. You'll get the traditional scrambled eggs, toast, bagel, juices tea/ coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ggllk
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel. I was upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. Each bedroom and the living room have a large flat screen and A/C is not noisy like in so many other hotels out there. It was very clean and comfortable. I would say, almost perfect. Breakfast is average. However, I fear it doesn't make sense to have such an hotel near the airport. Staying there only one night to catch an early flight or get rest after a late one makes you feel disappointed you did not stay longer. But if you are planning on longer vacation in Miami; would you like to stay in the airport area? Anyway, the hotel itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mercedesmatt22
Reviews.Content: This place was far beyond my expectations. I booked this property since I needed a place for the night before an afternoon flight out of MIA. They offer convenient shuttle service to / from the airport. It's very close to MIA. The property looks great from the inside and out. Nicely groomed grounds, clean rooms, clean areas. I arrived and was welcomed by the GM. She upgraded me to a 2 bedroom suite. Wow! The room was huge and well equipped. I would without second thought stay here again - and this is the kind of place I wouldn't mind staying for an extended period of time. Breakfast was good ( I often don't even check out morning offerings ) plenty of fresh food, fruit, juices, etc. This place is ran by people that know what they're doing and care and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynn121946
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice on my way to and from St. Kitts. I was with my husband and 19-year old son, and I was delighted with the whole experience. I am a travel agent and tend to be picky, and I was very impressed with this property.The grounds are beautiful with palm trees and tropical flowers/plants all around. The pool is very nice, with lot of loungers and tables and chairs scattered around. It's a nice place to enjoy your morning coffee. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, and my son was delighted that he didn't have to sleep on a sofa bed. Both suites were very comfortable, each with their own bathroom. This is also helpful when there are multiple people trying to get up and out in a hurry. They have a complimentary breakfast that includes some kind of eggs, sausage or bacon, toast, bagels, muffins, juices and coffee and tea. There was something there for everyone. They also have an early evening wine and snack, but we weren't there for that. We took the complimentary airport shuttle, and it was prompt. The driver was nice enough to take us to a Cuban restaurant that's about a mile from the hotel and then picked us up when were finished. On the way back from St. Kitts, they recommended a seafood restaurant, and we took a cab to that. It was a nice, casual place with an outdoor patio with a huge TV screen. People were hanging out, watching Monday night football and enjoying oyster specials. This hotel is great for families or large groups who need to sleep a lot of people or for anyone who is staying or a while in Miami. The suites have full kitchens, so it makes it affordable if you have to feed a lot of people or are just tired of dining out. All in all, a great, affordable hotel with a friendly staff and nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Neilbond007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night at the start of a week long tour of florida. Upon check in was give a "non smoking" room. Went to the room at the end of the corridor and there was a strong aroma of stale cigarette smoke. This was indeed a "non smoking" room but the other rooms around it were smoking rooms. Called the front desk and they immediately swapped me to another 2 bedroom suite. As soon as I was checked in headed down to South beach. It's about a 15 minute drive in not the prettiest of neighbourhoods. Other than that the hotel was excellent. Looked virtually new, rooms were huge and well equipped. Breakfast was pretty standard fare. Used points to pay for the stay so can't comment on price. Did stop at the Homewood suites near the airport on another night and they're pretty comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - But Be Carefull with Shuttle !”
Reviews.Author: teek-e-nut
Reviews.Content: We needed a Hotel in the area for 1 night. The room was like a "mini-condo" . Very Clean and Nice. They have a small kitchen and seperate bedrooms. (Internet was slow) The Concierge was Very Very Helpfull. Good Complimentary Breakfast. *One word of Warning - be carefull not to get on the wrong Hyatt Shuttle - Miami Airport is always a Cluster-Fudge, and to compound the confusion, there is more than one Hyatt in the Area. - When you have your luggage, Call the Hyatt "Summerfield" and coodinate a pick-up point.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: TravelMore74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as per recommendations from this site and it exceeded and met all expectations. The staff was helpful and the room was nice and clean. The shuttle picked me up at the airport late in the evening/night with out a problem and I was able to easily catch a shuttle in the morning to get me to the port for the cruise. The breakfast was awesome and so was the coffee. Without a doubt I would stay here again. Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: arn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as a stop off in Miami. Hotel room is excellent. We had a 2 bedroom suite which had a lare double bed in each room and a bed settee in the lounge for which we paid $135. Room was ideal. Breakfast had a good choice (at 8:30) and had plenty of healthy options and Starbucks coffee. Hotel was easy to find and easy to travel into Miami and then upwards to Fort Lauderdale. Air conditioning was quiet in the bedrooms, the lounge area was a little noisy but we sorted that by setting the temperature to a setting it was rarely needed. Certainly the best hotel we stayed at on our trip round Florida.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: wildflower1966
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for the price. The rooms are spacious and clean. They transport you there from the airport. There is a grocery store right around the corner - so you can use the kitchen in your room (well equipped). My only complaint would be that there was no food left at breakfast. We got down there more than 30 minutes before it ended, but there was only coffee, even though the room was packed full of people (room not big enough). That was not a big deal for us since we were boarding a cruise ship that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: badgirlwanted
Reviews.Content: Waited outside Miami airport for the advertised shuttle in hot, muggy conditions. After 55 minutes, and seeing the shuttles from several other hotels pass by more than once, I approached taxi rank. They were not surprised that it was Hyatt that had failed to shoew up. Taxi charged me $14 to go to the hotel. When i arrived and explained the situation to the agent at the front desk, not a shimmer of remorse! Firstly, she told me that the shuttles only came when called but did not know how I would have got hold of the number. The website only has the central 800 number and makes no mention of needing to call. Nor is the hotel listed on the board at ther airport. she then said that the service stopped at 11:30pm. I had been waiting from 11pm so that explains only the second half hour. however, the website lists the hours of service as 5am to midnight. Then i wanted to leave at 5:20am but was told the service would only leave every 30 minutes so i had to choose 5am or 5:30, even though no-one else was expected to use the service. The room was pretty good but frankly by that point all i wanted to do was sleep. In the morning, I wanted a coffee but guess what - no coffee service until 6am and no coffee had been left in my room to make my own. In short, stay away - you can do better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: SK40
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here one night before and after our trip to Barbardos. Once we retrieved our luggage, we called the hotel and they told us to proceed to the Departure Area (baggage retrieval was on the 1st floor, Departures are on the 2nd Floor) and wait for the Shuttle. It arrived about 25 minutes later. We had requested a Trio Suite (2 bedrooms, 3 beds) and were given a double. (If you make your reservations on-line, make sure you call the hotel and ask them to guarantee the rooms you chose.) We asked the front desk to change us, but unfortunately they were all occupied. So, they added a One Bedroom Suite for my husband and I at no charge! Our daughter (18) and son (21) had the Two Bedroom Suite, 2 King-Sized Beds, all to theirselves. Both rooms were on the 2nd floor, not far from each other. Now, that's what I call Customer Service! We checked in around 2:30 p.m., put our luggage in our rooms, freshened up, and asked about the cuban restaurant in the plaza behind the hotel (about a 10-15 minute walk). As we proceeded out of the property for our walk, one of the Shuttle drivers saw us, stopped, and took us to the restaurant. It was a hot and humid day so we were very thankful he saw us. We gave him a tip and went inside the restaurant. It was very clean and nicely decorated. We were the only one's there for the first hour and had fantastic service. The food was incredible as was the cuban beer they offered. We left the restaurant at about 5:30 p.m. (what can I say, we ate and ate and relaxed....we were on vacation!) and walked around the shopping complex on our way back to the hotel. My daughter and I found a shoe store with very inexpensive prices on sandals (buy one, next one 50% off) so she bought 2 pairs. We all then went into their Supermarket (Publix, I think) and bought some bottled water together with some munchies for later, although the kids bought ice cream from the hotel store around 7:30. The other food places we saw in the plaza was a nice looking Italian Restaurant and a Starbucks (there may be more but these were what we saw on the way back to the hotel). We took a leisurely walk back to the hotel (around 6:30 p.m.) as it was much cooler out. We all turned in pretty early because our morning started out around 4:00 a.m. The next morning, we went down and had breakfast which had a pretty good assortment (bagels, toast, danish, eggs, bacon, yogurt, cereals, milk, coffee, tea, juices, etc. Our flight to Barbados was 9:55 a.m., so we checked out and caught the 7:30 a.m. Shuttle. Upon our return, we were given the Trio Suite (3rd Floor). All suites were wonderful (both coming and going), extraordinarily clean, extremely quiet, and comfortable. The kitchen cabinets were stocked with all the conveniences of home for cooking and eating. We checked in at 7:30 p.m., after the last Shopping Mall shuttle picked up from the hotel, so we dropped our luggage into the room and asked the front desk to call us a taxi. It arrived about 10 minutes later and was around $23 to the Mall. I can't remember the name of it but it is huge. We ate delicious food at the Kobe Steakhouse and had a fun time. We caught a waiting taxi found easily outside the eating establishments. The next morning, we ate breakfast again and since our flight back to Vegas was not until 4:00 p.m., we asked for a late check-out (1:00 p.m.) and washed our clothes from the last 2 weeks in the Guest Laundry. You can purchase detergent and softener in the hotel store. We ordered pizza for lunch (from menus slipped under the hotel doors) at 11:30 which was suppose to be delivered at 12:00. Unfortunately, it was delivered at 12:55 and was cold, but the Front Desk was very kind and told us we could stay in our room to eat it. We warmed up the pizza, ate, ran the dishwasher, and checked out around 1:35. Oneof the Shuttle Driver's saw us coming off the elevator and took us directly to the airport instead of making us wait until 2:00. Our experience with this hotel could not have been better. If we ever come back to Miami as a stopover to someplace else, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: swelliott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in transit overnight at Miami on the basis of recommendations that I read on Tripadvisor. I have stayed at other "all suite" hotels in the US and they have generally been disappointing, but this was really outstanding.I arrived late, but the receptionist was friendly and helpful. The room was the size of a small apartment, clean, well furnished and fully equipped with a new dishwasher, microwave, cooker and coffee machine. Breakfast was included in the room rate and had a good choice on offer. The hotel seems to be popular with cruise ship passengers joining ships in Miami and I can understand why.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lodging for the Price Paid”
Reviews.Author: Radiojunkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a cruise. Arrived late but check-in was a breeze and staff was good. The room was a 2BDR suite for the 2 of us which could sleep 6. Breakfast buffet is free and very good. The only gripe I have is that the A/C didn't work though the front desk said they would fix it; they tried but no dice. Good thing it was March and not July! We only stayed overnight and the cost was $199+change, a good value for what we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Western Carribean Cruise”
Reviews.Author: TravelNewby
Reviews.Content: We arrived at MIA Saturday, 3/21/09 just before noon. Called the hotel for the shuttle. Shuttle arrived about 25 minutes later. Driver was very friendly and the ride to hotel only about 10-15 minutes. Check-in was a breeze. Our 2 bedroom suite was wonderful. King bed and full bath/ivanitiy in one bedroom, 2 double beds and full bath/vanity in the other. Living room had a sleeper sofa and each room had flat screen tv's. Full kitchen with microwave, dishwasher, stove and refridgerator. There were 6 women and we weren't crowded at all! The hotel has a nice pool and hot tub area and complimentary breakfast in the morning. We found a publix, liquor store, drug stores and a couple of fast food restaurants all in walking distance. The only negative I would say is other than fast food the only restaurant within walking distance was a cuban one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_PSW
Reviews.Content: We used up our Hyatt points and stayed at the Summerfield Suites the day before cruise and the day after our cruise. The rooms are spacious, newer, nice decor and very clean. The staff is super nice. The only comment my husband made was that he wished they had a restaurant in the hotel because we flew in late but had not eaten all day. They did though have a small store with things for sale. We luckily came in to a flyer from a pizza place and ordered in. I did not make it to breakfast but my husband said that they had a nice spread. We would stay here again pre and post cruise. Convenient to the port of Miami and airport.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Miami airport area”
Reviews.Author: RJ3301
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a bad experience at a neighboring property and could not have been more pleased. We got a comfortable two room suite for a very reasonable price through Expedia. They offer free parking, free shuttle service and a free managers reception nightly where appetizers and drinks are served at no charge. Our room had three large screen TVs and a full kitchen. Breakfast is also free. If you are in Miami this is the place to stay. The only negative comment I have is that the security deadbolt would not aligned with the door frame, meaning that it would not lock properly. There is a safety latch that works, I reported this to the front desk in the morning and they advised that they,had this problem with a number of rooms and were working to correct it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: traveling_teacher611
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt the night before our Royal Caribbean Cruise set sail. There is a free shuttle that picked us up from the airport and took us to the hotel. The ride was less than 5 minutes. The room we had was large. Since my husband and I were with my parents, we were pleased that there was an actual door between the living room with pull out couch and the king bed room. The pool was great - clean and quiet. There was very little noise from the airport. In addition, the hotel had an updated and large bathroom as well as a kitchen area (fridge, microwave, dishes, etc). Also, since we only did carry on luggage and needed to buy sunscreen, we were pleased that there was a CVS about two blocks away, as well as a Starbucks and I think a McDonald's. However, the hotel breakfast was good - cereal, a few hot items, oatmeal, fruit, juices, etc. Overall, would stay again. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, huge rooms, excellent staff, great breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: cabernetMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a cruise and the staff and management are excellent!! We walked around the corner and had dinner at a cuban restaurant that the staff recommended and bought wine at the liquor store in the same strip mall. The shuttle service from the airport was quick and easy and the breakfast was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Kitsilano
Reviews.Content: Two-bedroom suites are enormous and would easily accommodate two couples travelling together (as on our recent stopover in Miami en route to the Caribbean). Well equipped kitchenette; nice pool; free Internet. Lots of provisions food and wine wise within walking distance. Our only quibble is that the breakfast available "until ten" on Sunday morning really ran out about quarter to ten, and items weren't refilled.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with hotel”
Reviews.Author: janetEastbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two night stay to acclimatise before going on a cruise. Accommodation was clean and spacious and would have been ideal for a family of four with full size dishwasher, freezer, microwave and cooker who wanted it for a base, but we just wanted to relax. There was also a safe but it did not work (and the water ran out of the bath and sink before you could finish using it as plugs did not fit) There was no bar in the hotel and we were directed across the main road to the Soffitel where a glass of wine was 17 dollars! oh plus 15% service and 8% tax. The pool was small and too cold to swim in. A taxi to port was 30 dollars, so probably in hindsight not the best choice. Also very disappointingly, breakfast was with plastic knives and forks and disposable plates? Not what I would expect for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “front desk staff are great”
Reviews.Author: Lindafrommichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Summerfield on the night before a cruise departure. We had a car and needed to park it in a safe place for the week. The hotel is surrounded by a fence and felt secure. Danubio checked us in and cound not have been any better at his job. He was very helpful and friendly. The room was very comfortable although it is close to airport the noise did not seem to bother us at night. Taxi to Port of Miami was $25.00 going and $30.00 coming back for 4 people. The shuttle was $12 per person. We took a taxi and were glad we did as the shuttle people were still waiting as we took off. Breakfast was included. We ordered Chinese take out and had it delivered and used the dishes in the little kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Could Not Have Been happier !”
Reviews.Author: MyNameIsLaila
Reviews.Content: This is the best Miami hotel that I have ever stayed at. - Friendly & Helpful Gentleman at the front Desk. - The room was clean and well appointed., with a full kitchen. - Nice location.; close to restaurants & some stores., and safe enough to walk to. -Nice (free) breakfast, with eggs & sausage, muffins, fruit,.... We were very happy with this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Brasil
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they didnâ€™t have a room with a king-size bed. Then, I told I was in honeymoon and they searched again but they only had a room with 2 beds. They gave as a wine as a honeymoon gift. The room was huge and very clean. Staff were sympathetic and helped us a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: kckaceykc
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay one night at MIA in order to catch our early morning flight to New Orleans the next day. The hotel is okay, fairly basic, but clean. We didnt find the reception staff that friendly or chatty, but that again is okay for just one night. Breakfast is buffet with paper plates, plastic cutlery, etc... but okay. In the early evening the hotel is very noisy, presumably from all the families staying but soon quieted down and we managed to get a good nights sleep. The transfer to the airport was great, and the driver a real help.

Reviews.Title: “We need more hotels like this”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt Summerfield Suites several times over the past few months. One of the better choices in Miami. The rooms are very comfortable, with plenty of space. The staff are friendly. Getting to the hotel from the airport couldn't be easier (for that matter, the hotel is just a few blocks from the Dolphin Expressway, so it's easy to hop on the expressway and head east to Miami Beach or north to Ft Lauderdale). The grounds are much more attractive than what one might ordinarily expect for a hotel of this class. This hotel seems to be popular with airline flight crews. Having said the above, I would rate the Hampton Inn across the street as a slightly better option, assuming you can find equivalent rooms for the same price at both places. The breakfast buffet has much better choices at Hampton Inn. I never had any internet wireless access problems at Hampton Inn, but often found the signal dropping while at Hyatt. Security was better at Hampton Inn; you have to use your room key to activate the gates to the parking garage and to take the elevator up to the guest rooms at Hampton Inn, whereas at Hyatt Summerfield you just park your car in an open lot surrounding the hotel and there is no room-key control of the elevator. (Even so, I have felt very safe during my stays at Hyatt Summerfield.) And some of the cardio equipment in the fitness room at Hyatt Summerfield needs to be repaired. While staying at Hyatt Summerfield, I did occasionally hear airplanes, not surprising with the airport being relatively close by. The noise was really not very loud and did not bother me much, but if you are very sensitive to this kind of distraction, you might want to look for a hotel further from the airport, or at least ask for a room toward the other side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “My first 'Suite'”
Reviews.Author: Krisk0
Reviews.Content: This my first stay in this type of accomodation as we thought this would be a good option now that my daughter is getting older (15 yrs). On arrival the reception was friendly and I was soon on the way to my 1 bed suite. Innocently I looked around for the third bed, not finding one or any linen, I went back to reception. The guy said that it was all within the sofa/settee arrangement. Anyway the upshot was that he offered to give me an upgrade to a 2bed suite to make it easier for me!! Checking back in the original room it was all set up as he suggested. Anyway the hotel was great. Breakfast was plentiful, freshly topped up with hot and cold food and the staff were very friendly. Only small problem is that there is no bar/coffee shop on the premises although beer was available at a small reception shop.

Reviews.Title: “well priced”
Reviews.Author: InTheWorldCec
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Stayed for 2 nights before a cruise. Was upgraded on arrival to suite with 2 double bedrooms. Free shuttle from the airport. A shuttle bus to the Dolphin Mall goes from the hotel next door for $10. Breakfast included, reasonable choice but breakfast room could get a bit crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryjenw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. This is a great hotel and I would stay here again. We had a one bedroom suite for our family (2 adults and 2 kids). It was great to have the extra room after a long day of flying. The room was clean and new. The staff was friendly. We had a small wait for the shuttle van at the airport but not that bad. The breakfast in the morning had enough to choose from. Not a huge selection but everything was replenished quickly and was fresh. There is a grocery store about a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious rooms, great staff service”
Reviews.Author: bpNC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, from the staff at the front desk, to the layout of the rooms, and the breakfast in the morning. Everything was excellent, and I was surprised at the level of atttentativeness and friendliness. Also, grab dinner at Casa Juan next door if you're looking for an excellent Cuban meal. The recomendation was from the front desk, and wow was I surprised! Unassuming as the place looked, the pollo asado was right on!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Peaceful and Refreshing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ikedeska
Reviews.Content: Checked into this gem for four nights based on reviews from Trip Advisor and did not regret it for a moment. The room was a large one bedroom suite which was very clean and welcome with its well placed kitchenette and spacious living room as well as bedroom. The decor and ambience were great. The front desk guy (called Gus I believe) was extremely polite, efficient and made me feel truly welcome. I would gladly recommend this place to others as I had an Excellent, Peaceful and Refreshing stay. Will definitely go back when next in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for stopover or longer stay”
Reviews.Author: silvergate
Reviews.Content: Given the very positive reviews on this web site, we chose to book for a one night stay between flights in and out of Miami. Check-in was handled by friendly, competent staff, and subsequently opening the door to our room resulted in a surprise. The suite was of the size of a one bedroom apartment with fully equipped kitchen, SS appliances, a comfortably furnished living room with a large flat screen TV and a writing desk with complementary Internet access. The bedroom with a superbly comfortable bed, a second flat screen TV, and a separate dressing area left little to be desired. The well lit dressing area with a large vanity, big enough to be comfortably used by two people at once, was separate from from the bathroom. The bathroom came with a tub/shower combo, quality towels, ample toiletries, but toilet paper of a see-through quality. . All was super clean and rather new, as was the facility as a whole. Breakfast, included in the room rate was served buffet style with a surprisingly good selection of items including scrambled eggs, sausage links, French toast, a basket of selected fruit, plus the usual coffee, tea and juices. Despite the close proximity to the airport, planes taking off during the night would only trouble a very light sleeper. The shuttle service provided convenient and reliable service to and from the terminal area. All in all, this hotel offers value for the price paid and serves well for a one night stopover or for an extended stay in a comfortable suite.

Reviews.Title: “you get much more than what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: 1allsop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites for a week and really enjoyed it. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms (all with a separate kitchen/living with a new flat screen tv) are spacious and nicely furnished. Then there is to mention that unlike many other hotels in same area (the Sofitel being one) at the Hyatt the do not charge extra for car parking, in-room wifi as well as an adequate breakfast. The vicinity to the international airport causes no annoyance and you cannot hear any plane starting or landing. Summing up: going to the Hyatt Summerfield Suites is definitely a no brainer: you get much, much more for your bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best Suites Ever!”
Reviews.Author: bonstehill
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from Tripadvisor I went with Hyatt Summerfield Suites in Miami to book reservations for the day before and the day after our cruise. I am so glad I took the advise from the users of Tripadvisor! We had a wonderful stay. Our stay at the suites was better than our cruise! Everything about our stay was great. The front-desk people were wonderful, particularly Jannesse, and the shuttle service was more than we expected. Not only did we get a free ride from and to the airport, but the driver also offered to take us to restaurants around the suites. We also used Liebt Way Tours to transfer us to the port, we later used their services to take us on a tour to Southbeach. Driver Paulo was very nice to us and accomomodated us in ever way. We felt like royalty our whole stay. The breakfast and happy hour food was fantastic. The suites are beautifully decorated and very roomy for my family of five, which consist of a 11 and 13 year old. We travel alot and this was definitely the best stay ever! Please trust me and others who have written in, you will be pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadianIslanders
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took advantage of a special web offer for an upgrade to a 2 King room unit for a very small amount per day. We were very happy with the hotel. It is in a very nice area next to a small shopping centre that had a large grocery store. The hotel was exceptionally quiet, especially for an "airport" hotel. It was only one storey and the rooms were great. The unit had full sized appliances and was well equipped. It was also in a good location for the areas we visited and near to the major roads. We were very happy during our four day stay. The staff were great as was the hot and cold free breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a layover/near the airport”
Reviews.Author: viajeraNYC
Reviews.Content: Spent the night of a layover here and it was perfect for my needs. They have a free airport shuttle during most of the day - it's 5 mins from the airport - or you can take a $14 taxi in off-hours. The rooms are clean and comfortable - all low-budget/basic decorations and fixtures - but just fine. The free breakfast is fairly extensive given the price of the room. What I really loved was the healthy and organic food choices in their mini-grocery store!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent self-catring, good value”
Reviews.Author: JPC1628
Reviews.Content: In an area of doubtful hotels (Miami Airport), the Summerfield suites offer very good quality overall for $200. The suites are vast: an adequate-size kitchen with very modern and big appliances, adequate cooking implements (the counter would make it difficult for more than two adults to have a meal without being crowded). The bedrooms have excellent bedding, with plenty of shelves and drawers for clothes. Each bedroom of the two bedroom suite has excellent bedding, its own big bathroom, and a good size desk with a superbly supportive office chair so you can work in comfort. Sizeable living area, with big flatscreen TV (in addition to CRT TVs in the bedrooms) The soundproofing will ensure that you are not disturbed by the frequent departures at MIA (you can hear them, though). Around the corner is a supermarket (Publix) where you can get all foods, and dismal hot roasted chicken, passable rice and other deli hot dishes. No restaurant in the hotel, and really no food to he had (potato chips ans drinks at the desk). The free breakfast is good, no more, with acceptable variety and choice. The rooms are such that a prolonged stay should be enjoyable. The airport shuttle service is excellent, quick on pick up and on time for dropoff (every 30 mn). It takes 5 mn. to the departure level of MIA (more during rush hours).

Reviews.Title: “Beats the other hotel chains 'suites' range.....”
Reviews.Author: Bowgreave
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation for Miami Airport but in nice part of town, close to a good mall with garage, banks, restaurants, etc. Got upgraded to 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, 3 TV suite with full range, dishwasher etc. For us these are the best suites chain, narrowly beating Embassy Suites and Hawthorne Suites, our two other favourites. Only downside, weary travellers looking forwards to a drink at the manager's reception hour will have to settle for coke, etc. until their license comes through....despite what it says on their website.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Place!”
Reviews.Author: backnforth
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms through HotWire at a great price and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious and the beds quite comfortable. Each bed had plenty of pillows. The check-in staff was very courteous. While parking in the parking lot late at night there was a guard in a cart that patrolled the area. This made us feel our vehicle was protected, not that it was a bad area at all. We were only there for a short visit the night before a cruise, so we didn't get to enjoy the pool or grounds. We wished we could have stayed longer. The free breakfast was an added bonus and had a little something for everyone. We will keep the Hyatt Summerfield Suites in mind for future travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre/Post Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RazorJim
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via priceline. The hotel was fantastic and met our expectations. We stayed in the hotel the morning before our cruise. The location is very close to the airport. We were picked up after a call in about 20 minutes--about the time we picked up our luggage. I believe there may be transfers available to the Miami port. We were boarding our cruise ship in Ft. Lauderdale so we didn't need the service. The hotel rooms were very big and about the size of a small apartment. We requested a king sized room and got that and more. The hotel put us up in a 2 bedroom 2 bath room complete with kitchen. The area is very nice and safe. The breakfast bar was great. Both hot and cold items were available. The hotel shuttle leaves every 30 minutes and were at the airport well ahead of schedule. The front office people were very nice and helpful. I'd recommend this hotel for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruise_Lover_Too
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Summerfield Suites on Feb. 1-2, 2008 before leaving on a cruise. We called the hotel to request the free shuttle pickup and after a short wait we were greeted by Alberto the driver who was very friendly. Since our flight was arriving early I had requested early check-in and when we arrived at the hotel we were checked in and Alberto helped us with our luggage to our room. Unfortunately when we walked into the room it smelled of cigarette smoke which was unacceptable to us and Alberto called down to the front desk, got our room changed, went downstairs to get the key for our new room and moved our luggage to our new room which was smoke free and very nice. It was a one bedroom which was very clean. It was great having a kitchen with a refrigerator that we could use to store water and soft drinks and a microwave to heat up leftover food from the restaurant we ate at. There was a TV and DVD in the living room area and a TV in the bedroom. The breakfast was great and had a nice variety of items to chose from - scrambled eggs, french toast, bacon, sausages, bagels, english muffins, toast, danishes, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereals, juices, milk, coffee and tea - much more then we expected from a continental breakfast. The shuttle was also available to take us to the shopping center which was nearby and picked us up. Alberto asked us if we needed a ride to the cruise ship dock and he made the arrangements to have the shuttle pick us up and take us to the ship for a nominal charge. The hotel staff was also very nice and helpful. Our overall experience at this hotel was very good and we would definitely stay at this hotel again if we have to stay in Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but a little bit run down”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: the Summerfield Suites are ideally located if you need to be close to the MIA Apt or if you have to do business in Doral or South Miami. The Hotel is ok, the rooms are ok, but the whole place is a little bit run down. Bfst is free, not that great though (but anyway...it is free). Free Internet. You should have a car as the shuttle service is basically only available to and from the Airport. They do not take you to other places. Staff at check in is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, friendly, and very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: LetsPack!
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Summerfield Suites the night before a cruise. I had my one year old son with me. He was able to crawl all over the extremely clean new carpet in the suite. We had a standard one bedroom suite. It included a full kitchen with dishes, pots, towels, cutlery etc..... The fridge came in really handy for my baby's milk. The breakfast buffet was delicious for what you pay, all inclusive. The staff was very professional. There is a Publix (market) one block away, Burger King, Wendys, Subway etc..... Very convenient for us right by the airport, yet no noise! I would stay there again anytime for a connecting flight or cruise. I would not stay there for a vacation because of the location. Everything else was perfect including the airport shuttle - right on time.

Reviews.Title: “OK Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel before a departing flight. Overall it was fine and the two bedroom suite was spacious. However, I did not feel the apartment had been particularly well cleaned before our arrival and the dÃ©cor looked tired. When we arrived we were unable to use the telephone to make a local call and despite sending someone up to the room, the staff were unable to resolve this. As there were some concerns about security in the surrounding area I wanted to make use of the room safe â€“ but there wasnâ€™t one. We certainly found being able to speak Spanish an advantage in the area and also with the hotel staff. We ate locally and despite being warned, found the area OK and there is a Publix supermarket very close to the hotel which is handy especially given the cooking facilities within the suites. We didnâ€™t try the breakfast but did make use of the free internet access from our room. We would consider this hotel again, depending on the price

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with 2 other adults, 2 children, and a baby on a Miami airport overnight layover. We had to wait about 20-25 minutes at the airport for the shuttle, which was less than ideal, but the driver was very friendly and our return shuttle to the airport the next day was easy and timely. The suite felt large enough and clean. Unfortunately, the showers drained slowly and the water took a very long time to get kind of hot, so that was disappointing. The kids used the pool and ate the free dinner which made things very convenient. The exercise room was nice as well. All of the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Overall we were happy with our choice and we felt like the hotel was a good value and perfect for an overnight with the family.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value with Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: TiredParentof2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying eight nights at the Summerfield Suites Miami Airport. This hotel was the best value we could find in south Florida for an upscale suite hotel (in particular, for a 2-bedroom suite). Overall, this is a pleasant, comfortable hotel, with courteous and helpful staff. However, it has a number of problems as well. Cleanliness: To be fair to the property, one cannot expect housekeeping staff to thoroughly clean the equivalent of over 100 small apartments every morning. However, except when we complained, what housekeeping did each morning was make the beds, change the towels, and throw the dirty dishes in the dishwasher and turn it on, then leave. We found the suite slightly dirty (particularly the bathrooms) upon arrival, and it appears the suite would only be fairly well cleaned between guests, regardless of the length of stay. We expected a more thorough cleaning at least every few days, but this did not happen. Rooms: We had a two-bedroom suite, however, in size it was smaller than other Summerfield Suites we have stayed in, and not quite as nicely decorated. There was one clock in the entire two bedroom suite (c'mon, this isn't Vegas), and were only two telephones in the entire suite (one in each of the bedrooms). We were severly lacking silverware and cups. Otherwise, the rooms were well furnished and equipped. Both bathtubs had a small leak so they did not stay filled. The living room had a flat panel TV (37 inch), each bedroom had a TV. We had free wireless internet, although it was about as slow as dial-up. The beds were pretty comfortable, and the air conditioning was efficient, although noisy in the living room/kitchen area. Buffet: What the last review said was generally true, the buffet (which had terrible food) was overwhelmed by hotel guests. Many items ran short, particularly over this holiday period. For example, they were out of lids for paper coffee cups for three days. A hotel like this generally has a mix of business travellers (waking early, eating light) and tourists (waking later, eating more or not at all), so the buffet can usually accommodate this trickle of guests with modest provisions and a small dining room. At this location, the buffet was just overwhelmed. The smaller evening happy hour had shortages also, but fewer problems. Overall, it was best to slip in, get a piece of fruit, toast and coffee, and escape to one's room. If the breakfast is a consideration, avoid this hotel. Staff: The staff were friendly and courteous, but ambivalent about the hotel running out of items such as kitchen towels and laundry bags. The shuttle to the airport did a nice job getting us to our flight, they have two nice vans and two drivers, but it is not a 24-hour service. (It cuts off at 10:30 p.m.) Security: While we were at the hotel, a guest had their portable NAV system stolen out of their unlocked car parked in front of the hotel. However, Miami police were parking around the hotel for the next couple of days. The immediate area of the hotel seemed safe enough, and we had no problems. I would advise locking your car and being aware of your surroundings. (It is Miami, after all) Location: The hotel is located in a narrow strip of hotels and office buildings between the airport to the north and residential Miami to the south. The nice areas of Miami generally are the south (Coral Gables, South Miami and Kendall) and the beach (Miami Beach, Key Biscayne). By driving south 15 minutes or east 15 minutes, either area could be easily reached. I ventured into the working-class mainly-immigrant area several blocks south of the hotel for some Cuban food, and felt the area was fine, but it is not the best area. The hotel is pretty convenient if you have a car and are flying in and out of the area and need relatively easy access to different areas of Miami. Key Biscayne has a very nice family beach ($5.00 for parking, north-east side of the island, called Crandon Park). You can avoid crowds of tourists by dining and shopping in South Miami, Kendall and Coral Gables. Just south of the hotel there are 24-hour Walgreens and CVS, we never seemed to find Publix (the supermarket) open by the time we returned to the hotel area. Pool, Fitness Center, Business Center, Barbeques: With the exception of the "business center" (4 computers with super slow internet) which seemed always in use, mainly by teenagers, the hotel facilities were generally nice and available. We did not use the pool or barbeques but they seemed nice enough. This type of hotel usually has no restaurant apart from the complimentary buffet, and this hotel had no restaurant and none adjacent to it. Price: At $204/night, this was 25-50% less than what this hotel would cost if it were located in Ft. Lauderdale or Miami Beach. However, the hotel has plenty of competition, with Homewood Suites and Hampton Inn (both suites hotels) nearby. I found the cheapest price directly on the hotel website, although I believe they can be booked through Priceline for less (probably a blind booking.)

Reviews.Title: “Confortable suites but inapropriate breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: jcparmentier
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 nights with my family in december 2007 for the Christmas holidays and we were accomodated in a one bedroom suite with 2 double beds. The suite was confortable and clean but the breakfast buffet was a nightmare every day. The place was crowded and people had to wait a long time to get to the buffet and have their coffee and meal. Most of time if you arrived at 9.30 am there was nothing left to drink or eat. If you arrived earlier there were not enough seats to accomodate everybody so the only way to have breakfast was to pick up your cup and plate and move to your room. So although the suites are spacious and clean I would'nt recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Supercilious
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for one night before our Caribbean cruise on the Norwegian Jewel. This is an excellent choice for families needing a hotel just prior to or after a cruise. The suites are well appointed and spacious. The beds are firm and very comfortable with plenty of pillows. There is a large, flat screen TV in the living room but there is no hi def content. There was no ice in the fridge so we had to get it from the front desk. We had an air conditioner problem and had flooding in one of our bathrooms. The staff was very courteous and worked on the problem but it was still happening the morning we left. This would have been a bigger concern if we were staying more than one night. There is a nice pool and jacuzzi. The pool though was too hot. The staff seemed to be aware of the problem but it was not fixed while we were there. The morning breakfast buffet is better than most hotels. There were many offerings including eggs and bacon as well as fruit, yogurt, breads and cereals. The shuttle from the airport worked well and the hotel arranged for our transport to the ship as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ode2life
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel today. Friends booked the room, so I don't know about the pricing and ease of reservation, but I really enjoyed the stay here. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was very clean and nicely decorated. I felt compelled to write this review when I spent some time in the pool area and noticed how clean and well-kept the jacuzzi and pool are. I would definitely stay here again. Oh yeah, and the continental breakfast was really nice too. I only ate there one day and the menu consisted of toast, yogurt, cheese omelettes, corned beef hash and fresh fruit. Looking forward to staying here again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: tanorml
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. Got a 2 bedroom suite which was nice, clean and modern. Kitchen was ok but we couldn't find a pot to boil water in so we used the coffee machine. The rooms were tastefully decorated and the living room had an LCD TV with DVD player which was a nice touch. Service was pleasant and friendly. Complimentary breakfast was good with hot food, breads, cereals, fruits, milk and juices offerred. Location was at a fairly quiet end of the airport and wasn't too difficult to find from the airport. The only downer was the complimentary airport shuttle stopped operating after 10 PM which forced us to take a taxi from the airport since we arrived afer midnight. Otherwise, a pleasant stay at a newer facilitiy that I would definitely consider staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: smack31
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near restaurants, CVS, Walgreens & McDonalds. Their is a hotel shuttle to and from the airport free of charge. If you are going on a cruise, to get to and from the port is $27.00. The hoel is clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii50Lover
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Summerfield Suites on August 2, 2007 for our cruise the next day. We arrived at the Miami Airport 1 pm sharp. As instructed by the hotel employee previously, we called the hotel for the free shuttle to pick us up. We were told the shuttle should arrive around 1:15pm. Later, the employee called and said the shuttle was running 30 minutes behind. He told us to get a taxi to the hotel and the taxi fare will be taken care of by the hotel. I was skeptical, but since I had no way of knowing when the shuttle is actually going to arrive, we went ahead and got a taxi. When I arrived at the hotel, I put the taxi fare receipt on the counter,. Without my saying a word, the front desk clerk handed me $14 cash. We paid $61 through Hotwire for the room. It came to $73 with taxes. We had a one bedroom suite with full kitchen. Everything looked really nice, new, and clean. The king size bed was comfortable with new linens. The kids slept on the sectional sofa bed. Our room was facing the street and a corner of the airport (I could see the tails of the planes), but it was surprisingly quiet. If you are very sensitive about sounds, you may have to request rooms in the back of the hotel. They had freshly baked chocolate chip and peanut butter cookiesin the lobby aound check-in time. We also had free dinner (Thursdays until August 31) that night at the hotel. The next morning, we had free breakfast buffet (every morning). Free coffee, tea, and soda were available through out the day. We saved quite a bit of money on dining by staying at Hyatt Summerfield. The hotel was within walking distance to Publix. We purchased many essentials that we could not put in our carry-ons. In the evening, the kids had a blast in the pool, making new friends in the process. All in all, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short stay”
Reviews.Author: chaucerquest
Reviews.Content: I concur with the largely positive reviews below. My husband, mother in law, and I stayed in a two bedroom suite to break up our journey from Latin America before returning to our different home towns. The suite had two full bathrooms, three TVs, a full kitchen, and internet service. We paid $279, which doesn't sound like a great bargain, but it was cheaper than two standard rooms we could find at any comparable hotels. The suite was clean and comfortable and the bathrooms were a cut above average. For those who couldn't find the wastebaskets, they are in he cabinets under the sink in both bathrooms. We didn't use the pool, but it looked fine; more like something kids would enjoy at the end of the day than a place you would want to spend the afternoon. For dinner we walked around the block to a Cuban restaurant in the same shopping center as the Publix grocery store. It was pleasant and reasonable. The breaksfast buffet was more than ample, with many choices: cereal, yogurt, fruit, french toast, bacon, various breads (including bagels) that you could toast yourself, and crossiants. On departing, we took advantage of the hotel shuttle for the ten minute (or less) ride to the airport. The driver was helpful and acted like he enjoyed providing the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms/Value”
Reviews.Author: FortMacLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days pre-cruise and found it to be awesome. Conveniently located to the airport for a late arrival flight. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was great, just make sure you get there early as the times seemed a little off. The food was good and for a small complimentary breakfast there was a good variety. The pool was very nice and never busy. There was not a lot of inside or outside noise that we ever heard in our room and I am a very light sleeper. We had booked a 2 bedroom as we were travelling with our son (16) and daughter (12). It was very nice to have the two very large rooms with enough space for all our luggage and us. The beds were very comfortable and there were two nice bathrooms. The kitchen was a real convenience if just for snacks and drinks. The only inconvenient part is the location as it is quite far from alot of the tourist type things. One way cab fare to Dolphin Mall is $25. Downtown Miami we were quoted as at least $40. If you are renting a car or don't plan to do alot of touring around, this won't be an issue. We would definitely stay here again under the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Summerfield Miami”
Reviews.Author: MiamiVice620
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Mar 23 - 27 2007 and was initially skeptical prior to booking based on limited reviews and location... no much else available on a busy weekend in Miami (Doral Open, tennis, 2 music fairs and Spring Break) Trip was an RR break with spouse. As we approached hotel we both noted that the grounds were beautifully maintained and the facility was clean, modern and well maintained also. The room (2 bedroom/2 bath/2 kings) was spacious, roomy and well furnished (3 TV's) . The beds were extremely comfortable and service was friendly and professional. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place, it was perfect for our needs, the best part was the 'full' kitchen (stove, small microwave dishwasher and frig). The location could be a problem for those without a car, but if you have a car it's a straight 12 minute drive on 836 to SoBe, $1.25 toll one way. Amenities: Heated pool, jacuzzi, washer/dryer on site. Have previously stayed at Mandarin Oriental, Marriott South Beach, Marriott Key Biscayne, Loews, Surfcomber and Conrad Miami and Summerfield Miami Airport ranks with the best in overall satisfaction and value. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: HP14
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the best value hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. Rooms (suites) are enormous and far larger than flats (apartments) that people live in in Europe. There is a well equipped kitchen, a large living area with a door through to the bedroom which leads to the sink area and finally the bath/shower room and toilet. Everything was new, clean and well cared for. The kitchen was good (there is a Publix a couple of minutes walk away) but did not overpower the living room â€“ unlike some places where the whole space feels as though itâ€™s a kitchen with a chair and a bed thrown in. The living room and bedroom each had a tv and there was free internet access at the desk in the living room. A reasonable breakfast and early evening snack was also included. Staff were absolutely charming and friendly, way better than in many grander places. So would I stay here again, certainly, if I had to be near the airport or for work (as was the case), otherwise the location â€“ near the airport but not much else would make me think twice unless I had a car. However particularly given the vast prices and not necessarily great quality of hotels on South Beach (to which I decamped for the weekend in the middle of a 2 week stay) this represented exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Bring Your Reservation”
Reviews.Author: Breter
Reviews.Content: - Great value. - Big clean room with full kitchen. - Great Location. - Quiet - Security patrols the grounds. - Ate at Cuban place around the corner. Great food at a great price. - Front desk tried to over charge. Good thing we had our reservation printout. - Outside of the building is covered with mold but the inside is clean and odor free. - Wireless internet service is in the lobby and food area only.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best- Front desk terrible”
Reviews.Author: michiganjeff
Reviews.Content: The only positive aspect of this property in my opinion is the size of the room. I stayed with my family in a 2 bedroom unit. It was quite spacious and met the needs of a family of 4. Although the room was large, it was decorated in a dark decor and I felt that housekeeping could do a better job by providing more towels and toiletries in the room. Our air conditioner in our room went out at 4p.m. on a HOT August day. Upon calling the front desk, it took two hours for someone to look at it, and one hour for him to tell us he can't fix it. In addition, 2 or our 3 televisions were broken. I demanded a different room, which I received. The a/c was working in the other room but the televisions were not. I was told by the front desk that he would send someone out to look at the televisions. Needless to say, after three additional phone calls and being told "he is on the way", I decided to call it a night. because I was not going to partake in this "song and dance" anymore. Upon checkout, I vehemently explained my disgruntledness, yet only received Im sorry......I will forward this to my manager. I understand that Hyatt has taken over this property....They really need to send the staff to hotel school. Next time, I will pay more and stay somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: joparke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before, but this time I was able to use more of its facilities and was very happy with the service and amenities. I only stayed there the weekend (Fri night to Sun afternoon) but it was good. Check in was quick and easy. Room nice, clean and of course spacious! TV in bedroom and living room, wine classes, plates, microwave everything you need in a kitchen. For the first time, I used the pool, which I believe is heated, or maybe it was just a hot day. I also used the Spa hot tub- at 104 degrees, it was great for the body. They also have a game room, with Ms. Pac man and car racing games etc. so it was nice to see the children enjoying that. What I appreciated the most was the bathroom size, free easy parking, and the US$80 per night rate I got. But, I would pay their regular rate because of the convenience of it all. Will surely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: imadurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our caribbean cruise in late July 2006. They gave us the option of a two room smoking suite even though we were non-smokers. The room did not smell like smoke and it was AWESOME having two rooms with two separate bathrooms. The hotel was very clean and quiet, and the breakfast in the morning was more than adequate. The facility is well cared for and the staff was extremely helpful and attentive. We would stay here again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place.....”
Reviews.Author: Indra_724
Reviews.Content: The place was wonderful and the facilities were good. Though the hotel is situated near the Airport, it didn't have any noise. Good Place. Could Recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Verry good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Been there for business in the first week of june 2006. Rooms were large en clean. Breakfast was good. The room was cleaned every day. Personel was friendly. No negative comments about our whole stay. I can reconment it for business stay. LAE & JD (The Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: JBIowa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 16 month old son, checked into the Summerfield Suites enroute to joining my wifeâ€™s family on a Western Caribbean cruise. The hotel is happy to pick you up anytime from the Miami International airport, which is about a 5-10 minute drive but they will not drive you to the bay/port from where cruises start. We checked into a 1-bdr suite. The suite had a separate living room with attached kitchenette and a separate (there is a door in between) bedroom with attached bathroom. The kitchen has a dishwasher, microwave, and fridge; you may want to bring your own dishwashing liquid. The infant bed was a proper bed and not just a pack-n-play; but they did not have blankets for the small bed. The shower was among the best I have ever used, in terms of adjustable water temperature and pressure. The rooms are spacious. The carpets spelt fresh even with the generally high humidity of Miami. There is a VCR and TV in the living room and a separate TV in the bedroom. There is high speed free internet access (wireless). The hotel is a block away from a strip mall that has a gas station, a pharmacy, a Chinese restaurant, a fast food place, and a big supermarket (Publix). There is also a hospital nearby. The hotel has a bunch of coin-operated washers and dryers, but all except one were non-functional for the 4 days we stayed at the hotel. In May 2006, they charged $2 for a wash and $2 for 30 minutes of drying time which seemed a bit steep. The room did have an ironing board and iron but the board was wobbly and creaky. There is plenty of free parking. The neighborhood seemed very clean and safe. There are no great places to eat within walking distance. Some of the best restaurants in the city are at least a 20-30 minute drive. There is a nice swimming pool (no laps though) and a nice whirlpool (both shut at 10 pm). The pool area seemed to run out of pool towels often. There are several outdoor grills in the pool area. The morning breakfast is complimentary. The breakfast was not great but there was fresh fruit, cereals, scrambled eggs, milk, coffee; just the usual fare. The staff was very helpful, smiling, and just wonderful. At about $160 a night, it seemed expensive before we got there. But the comforts and ease of things ultimately made us not regret the price.
